Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
I am going to talk about a scam by the Matrix SIM card provider employees at the New Delhi Airport.

Many of you might be aware of this company which sells SIM cards for international travellers with plans which can work in the destination country. Its a very good service and their SIM cards cost much less than the international roaming packs provided by Airtel, Vodafone, etc. I was travelling to Bali, Indonesia and I saw their kiosk at the airport where 2–3 sales agents keep inviting passers by to buy their SIM cards. I went to their kiosk and this is how our conversation went:

Matrix Guy: Hello sir, which country are you travelling to?

Me: Bali, Indonesia. Do you have SIM cards for that country for like 7 days ?

Matrix Guy: Yes sir, we do

Me: How much will it cost?

Matrix Guy: Sir it will cost 1500/- INR

Then he went on and explained the plan details. I felt it was a good deal because my cellphone provider (Airtel) was quoting me 3000/- for an international roaming pack with almost the same services.

Me: Okay, I will buy 2 SIM cards, one for myself and one for my wife

Matrix Guy: Okay sir. May I have your passport?

I handed over my passport, he took a photocopy of it and kept it with himself. He also asked me my email address. Then he handed over the SIM cards to me and showed me the amount on screen which was 3064/- INR for 2 SIM cards

I gave him 3100/- in cash and he was supposed to return me 36/-

Matrix Guy: Sir, I don’t have change

Me: Okay, no problem. I will pay with my credit card.

This made him a little uncomfortable and he and his colleague looked at each other. I thought perhaps he wasn’t willing to return the change but the actual reason was something else

Matrix Guy: Sir, please see if you have change?

Me: I am pretty sure I don’t. But I can pay with credit card. What’s the problem with that?

Matrix Guy: Let me see if I can arrange the change.

He asked another colleague of his for change and he handed over the change from his wallet. He gave me those 30/- INR and asked me if it was ok? I said fine, took the change and left. I didn’t bother to ask for a receipt or a bill and that was my mistake.

Next day I get 2 emails from Matrix with the bill for both the SIM cards and then I realised why the guy became uncomfortable when I offered to pay via credit card. This is the screenshot of the bill

The total amount for each SIM card that I was supposed to pay was 1331/- and the actual amount I paid was 1532/-. The difference is insignificant for the customer but depending on how many SIM cards they sell everyday, they are earning a good amount of money scamming people and their own company as well.

Remember he never gave me any receipt for the payment? That’s why!

Also, if I had transacted via credit card, then he could not have initiated a charge of more than the actual amount.

So, next time you buy a SIM card from Matrix, make sure to pay via credit card and insist on getting the receipt for the payment. Hope this answer helps other people from getting scammed by those Matrix employees and I hope the company takes some strict action against those employees engaging in such unethical behavior.

UPDATE: I have received the full refund from Matrix. For two weeks they did nothing and after posting about the incident online, I got my money back in 2 working days. I don’t know if they took any action against their employees at the airport who are scamming people but at least I got my money back and since this answer has gathered so many views and upvotes, I hope a lot of people have been made aware of this scam. Thanks to Quora and all the Quorans for the support.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Not sure if this is common but definitely worth highlighting.

Our 4 year old LEDTV suddenly didn't work.

When I called the customer care, they agreed to send an engineer. But he's to be paid a “conveyance n consultance” fees of 400/- irrespective of the issue and subsequent charges to repair it.

I reluctantly agreed.

An engineer visited the home and inspected the device jus by tapping on the TV screen at random places ; didn't even unmount the TV from wall stand.

He then asked me to sign a form regarding inspection details and asked for the “fees”

When I asked him what the issue was, he attributed it to a fault in motherboard panel and it had to be replaced wholly at a whopping cost of 16k INR since the TV is past its guarantee period !

He also dismissed any alternate less-expensive solutions.

As he left, I wondered if I had to buy a new basic model LED TV or a second hand feature rich model .

Hours spent on Google, Flipkart, Amazon, Quikr were of no use.

After a colleague's suggestion, finally, it struck me to search for a local electronics service center.

And lo ! A guy arrived at an agreed time, unmounted the device and inspected. Then he requested the device to be taken to his shop to check for further issues. Only upon his confirmation of possibility to repair along with cost details he said he'd proceed .

Next day he said he could repair the TV by changing few ICs at a cost of 2500 INR. I struggled to agree to the cost without sounding surprised.

Few days later, he came back with the TV, connected the DTH himself and demonstrated it worked normally again.

I finally gave in to my temptation and narrated my ordeal before reaching out to him.

When asked why there's so much cost difference, he smiled signing off “If companies attend to repair works at IC level, then they can hardly thrive”

Beware of Samsung !

A few days later when I got a call from Samesong seeking my feedback they received an earful.

It's been few months then since my TV was repaired and I almost forgot it till I saw this question.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
December 2014. It was my 3rd month in Bengaluru. I was in a Tea shop, waiting for a friend. A strange young man came to talk to me. He was around 25 with a gentle man look. For now, let’s call him Gentle Man.

So, the conversation went like this:

Gentleman : Hey, sorry, can you tell me what the time it is?

Me : Hi, It’s 6pm.

Gentleman : Okay. I’m waiting for my friend here for last 20 minutes. What are you upto?

Me : Same here too.

(Some casual talks went on for sometime)

Gentleman : I guess we are like-minded people. Even I used to work in IT and then quit to follow my passion. I now work as a tennis instructor.

(Well, that was the first time I have met someone who actually doesn’t work for IT in Bengaluru. That too someone who is following his passion! Impressed!)

Me : That’s great. I’m happy for you that you are following your passion. I fell into the IT trap and I don’t think there is an escape from this.

(My friend came in between, and I introduced him to the gentleman)

Gentleman : We actually have a group of people who are into day jobs, mostly IT, and trying to follow our passion. It’s like a self-help group who can mentor you to achieve your passion. Why don’t you guys join it?

(Well, at this point, we were pretty impressed by this idea, and thought that we would give it a try.)

Friend : We’d love to. (And exchanged phone numbers)

The next day, we got a call from him, asking if we can make it to a party this weekend. We got excited as we had never been to a party in this city before. We accepted the invitation , and got dressed up for the party.

We followed the Google Maps to get to the location he gave and, it felt a bit unusual because it took us to a residential area. I could see no trace of any party happening there and felt quite doubtful about the whole thing. Then, the gentleman called us on the phone and directed us to a house there.

We could see around 40–50 people dressed up in formals in the house. It didn’t look like a party but more like a business meeting. And we were, there in the middle of all people there, in bright colored dress, trying to figure out what is happening? The gentleman greeted us with a smile of accomplishment on his face and asked us to be seated in the carpet along with the fellow guys in the formals. I looked around, there was no trace of any drinks, food or anything. I slowly realized that there is no party. *Sigh!*

And then, a power-point presentation was started and only then we realized what we have fallen into . It was actually a meeting of a Pyramid Scheme
 business. Adding to the damage, an award was given to our gentle man during the meeting, for trapping more people into their so-called business. He then asked both of us to stand up during the meeting, and asked us to give a testimony on how we feel about joining the business. I went to the mic and told something like

“I feel so excited to be part of this meeting. Nice to meet you all. Thank you.” (All I wanted then was to run away). My friend also repeated same sentences.

After the presentation, the gentleman introduced us to many people there in the group. Everyone had a fake smile on their face and it read like- You are trapped mf! The Gentleman asked us to submit a blank copy of our bank cheque, PAN and other details to join the business. We assured them that we will submit everything on the next day.

They gave us a bag of some books, catalogs and DVDs, to learn the act of trapping more people. We thankfully accepted everything and went out of the house and dumped everything into a drainage just outside that house and went home.

The next day, the gentleman called us to collect the PAN and other details and we literally asked him to f*uck off. He was so pissed off and was swearing at us. This ended up in a swear war and he lost it. He threatened us that if we don’t return books and DVDs, we would face its consequences. And we asked him to collect it from the drainage near his house and disconnected the call and blocked his number.

Months later, this business was blacklisted and associated people were charged for fraud. Well, ours was a narrow escape!

Thanks for reading,

J

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
India's water purifier scam.If you have a RO you should definitely read this.

These big companies loot us indians Because of our lack of knowledge and fool us.

*Edit 1 and 2 are important*

While selling a purifier many sales man use two tactics to dupe us into believing that we need purified water from their RO.

They use TDS meter.

This tool is used to check the impurities in the purifier

And according to those deceiving salesman the lower the number the better it is.The bigger the number the more impurities it has.

So what they will do is ,they will use this in your Normal water.The TDS will be around 60–150.

And then they will use their purifier's water/PACKAGED WATER and show that TDS is only 15.

And will tell us that “See ,that's why you should buy water purifier”

But what they won't tell is that this water is not “pure” it is highly “Demineralised” which means the important mineral contents are not there in the water.

According to WHO we can drink water upto 500TDS.

Now to prove this we use this meter in a mineral bottle water .

See the TDS is 246 in mineral bottled water .

That's why a mineral water bottle is better than a packaged water bottle cause it has essential minerals in it.

The second trick they will use it through this Device

“Electrolyte”.

So basically what they will do is ,they will place one end in your Normal water which is purified mineral water in this case and their “purifier's water “ in other.

After some time our normal water will turn yellow and they will tell us that we were drinking all these impurities.

Truth- These are not impurities but dissociated minerals because of the electrolysis process.

Just think for a second.Everyone knows this.

Distilled water is a very bad conductor of electricity coz it doesn't have any minerals in it.

Now using the same principle we now know that since the RO water has close to no minerals at all ,then electricity hardly passes through it and hence nothing happens.

So beware of those salesman who use these methods to scam you . who make you believe that your normal water is bad.There are other ways to find this out but not these two.They just there to scam you.

“Jaago Grahak Jaago!”

Credit to YouTube/Innovative Technocare .

Edit : I am not suggesting that ROs are bad .My motive was to spread awareness regarding the malpractices used by sellers.

Edit 2: TDS is not a right measure to check if a water is drinkable or not.Water which has 300TDS is drinkable if it doesn't have harmful minerals.

Also water with TDS 200 can be harmful to drink if it has harmful minerals.

A TDS meter does not measure contaminants. It will not tell you if your water is healthy. Some healthy minerals like potassium, magnesium, and calcium can actually cause your TDS meter to spike.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
**Beware of Rental Cars Scam**

So I took a rental car from Zoomcar for a trip from Pune to Mahabaleshwar. The car they have provided is all dirty and have an almost empty fuel tank(I had booked with fuel).

Remember whenever you choose for the with fuel option they provide you a car with an almost empty tank so that you will ask for a refund and they can play their trick.

After filling petrol we started our journey after some time, car breakdown happens. We were in the middle of Pune and Mahabaleshwar. We tried their customer support number many times but it was not working. After wasting an hour like this we decided to repair the car ourselves from a local mechanic(It costs us too).

After completing trip we park the car and lock it safely. We paid 2313 for the car + 3000 security deposit + 1000 fuel refund. So we should get 4000 as a refund(3000+1000).

After 2 days we found out that they have charged 4000 on the name of damage charges. The exact amount that should be refunded to us. Here is the receipt they have provided.

Yes, they charged twice for the same damage(1000+3000). I have no idea why? We should ask them to refund our money, to provide faulty car instead they are asking for damage charges from us. Can you believe that?

I was trying their customer support number but still, it is unreachable. After 2 weeks got a call from them, please clear the due charges in your zoomcar account. I asked them about the charges, they told me it is for car tyre damage(I returned it in perfect condition). I asked them did they have any proof, they told me yes we can link damaged car pics in your account, I said do it. After holding the call for about 15 mins they told me they are not able to find the pictures now, they will do it in two working days. Two months passed neither I got pics from them nor I got a call again. But the amount is still due in my account.

Remember Zoomcar is a total fraud. They will charge you heavily in the name of car damage even when it is not.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
THE UBER CANCELLATION FEES SCAM

(Uber drivers scamming for cancellation fees)

A few days back i booked an uber to the airport for my dad.

The uber map was showing that the driver will arrive in 4 minutes.

But 10 minutes had already passed and the map was still showing 4 minutes.

I called the driver as i was getting late. He picked up the call after 3-4 attempts.

Me: Bhaiya (Brother), where are you? The app is showing you are just 4 minutes away for the past 10-15 minutes.

Driver: Where do you have to go?

Me: To the Airport.

Driver: I'm not going there. You cancel the ride and book a new one.

Me: Wtf? You could've called or texted and told me that you will not go or atleast cancelled the ride. Also, you are the one who is not coming, you have to cancel the ride. Because of you we are already getting late. Now cancel the ride. Why should i get charged for your mistake?

Driver: I won't cancel the ride else it'll be deducted from my salary. You cancel the ride. It's not my mistake that i'm not going that way. You can cancel the ride and book a new one.

And the heated conversation continued for another 2-3 minutes but he refused to cancel it no matter what.

Finally, we were getting late, i said fuck it and cancelled the ride. I was charged ₹42 for the cancellation.

Not only me but it has also happened with a few of my relatives and friends. You don't expect this from a company as big as uber. It is so frustrating.

A petty amount like ₹42 doesn't matter that much but it takes away from the trust and loyalty with the service provider.

The customer care number too doesn't work. I don't think they attend calls and care about the customer. I hope they review their policy and bring some changes to this before people start deleting their app.

Edit : (Because of too many similar comments)

I got my refund as uber credits. But a friend of mine didn't get the refund. Uber said that they'll review with the driver and then they'll give the refund but he never got the refund despite sending emails.

As i said in the answer that more than the money lost the main issue is

Time of customer gets wasted. The person may be in a hurry like my dad was as he had to reach the airport.
Unnecessary arguments with the drivers can be so frustrating.
Also after that they refund the amount as uber credits which is of no use unless the uber app is used again.
Sometimes they don't even refund the money.
Trust and loyalty with the brand suffers.

And i have had bad experiences with ola in the past, that's why i switched to uber.

BITE ME

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This one SCAM always make my blood boil. I have fought a few times also but to no avail. I have raised the complaint as well but nothing happened.

So, the scam i am talking about is of DMRC. Yes, Delhi metro employees.

I am facing this scam from last 4–5 years and every now and then i see people getting scammed.

So, let me tell you how it works.

Suppose, i go to the ticket counter to get a token for myself.

Now, suppose the token money is ₹50. Now i don't have change so i gave the person on ticket counter ₹500.

So, he is supposed to give be ₹450 back right?

Now here the scam begins. The person on ticket counter would make sure that I am looking at him while he keeps ₹500 in the money box and takes out ₹450.

He will count it 5–6 times in front of my eyes very clearly so that I would realise that he has 4- 100 rupee notes in his hand and 1- 50 rupee note.

After he has done this and he has seen that you paid attention, now he would just slide his hand little inside the money box where the box's lid covers his hand and will quickly fold the money and give it to you along with the token.

Now, since he had already taken a lot of time and mostly people are in hurry so they just keep the amount in their pocket and move away. But, as soon as the person would count the money he would have ₹100 less. Now, if you go back to the counter and say you got less money they wouldn't even dare to ask a question. They would just handover the money to you and will say that why were you in such a hurry that you forgot your remaining amount.

The amount of time that will take you to realise that you received less money would vary and not everybody can go back and argue with the person at the counter.

So, now the person easily made ₹100 by scamming people. Now, just assume the number of people who board metro and who buy tokens.

In my experience, almost every time i give ₹500 note i receive ₹100 less. Many a times i have fought them as well.

Now, that I have learned what they do i usually wait till they do their trick and then just look dead in their eyes and they will give ₹100.

But, it really makes me angry thinking about the people who couldn't get their money back and were scammed and are still being scammed by these so called DMRC employees.

Image- Taken from Google for reference only.

EDIT :— All of the people who were telling me that I should use UPI or get a metro card, i have a metro card and yes we can pay with UPI now and i do give ₹500 note now but i know the scam so i count it well. But, the problem doesn't end here. I am more concerned about other passengers who don't use UPI and those who don't have metro card. Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
I am going anonymous as I had not shared this incident with someone and don't want them to know about it.

My personal experience of Urban clap. Booked for a plumbing service. The guy just had to change 3 leaking pipes of the overhead tank.Plumber arrives and inspects. Normally it would take maximum of 1–2 hours. . The guy asks an amount of 3500 for the service and but the amount shown on the app for service was nearly less than 500 or 1000. After a lot of discussion he asked 100 for this service and not actual work. Amount given the plumber walks away. I receive an email from urban clap: “ payment of 100rs received as per your request the service has been cancelled ”. I was literally in shock the plumber just acted over smart.

2nd time: same issue next day.

Booked for plumbing service. Guy arrives, inspects and says the work is a bit more and cannot be done by a single person. Tomorrow I'll apply for a holiday at office and complete your work and bring another person with me. Here amount remaines same 3500. Again I had to pay 100 but this time he said truth and asked the amount. Next day early morning he arrives with his co-worker(his 10 year old son) and starts working. I had bought all the pipes and stuff already. Within 3 hours he completed the work. Amount 3500 paid.

Now comes the real part the guy had not understood the connection properly and gave a cross connection. The tank had water but the taps were dry. I called him and said the issue. He replied it might be due to an airlock and suggested me some tricks to try. Nothing worked a Nd asked him to sort it out . After that he blocked my number.

After that I went to local plumbing stores to ask help of a plumber. Nearly after 4–5 plumbing stores found a plumber. He now checks for nearly 30min and then understands that a cross connection has been given and it is not an airlock. The plumber earlier has messed up all the connections. The whole work had to be done again and I had to spend an amount of 4500 this time.

Total amount I spent to change 3 pipes:100(cancellation) +125+3500+material cost + 4500+ material cost again. .. Nearly 8500.

I complained to urban clap but what action was taken I am unaware but that moment I uninstalled the app and shared the incident with max number of person I could.

I guess I learned the hard way.

Questions: What are some common frauds experienced in India?
Answers:
Quikr/OLX add Scam,

Reason I am writing it annonymous is many of my friends are on qoura and I don't want to look stupid to them. I lost 5000 today and don't want others to be victim of such fraud. Kindly read this answer carefully and it might help you to save your hard earned money.

I wanted to buy a second hand scooter and searched on Quikr to Check if any available. I came across this add.

I called the person and he introduced himself as a airport security personnel(Army) working at Ahmedabad airport. He asked me to meet at Ahmedabad airport terminal-2 for further check on scooter. I reached at airport morning 11:00am and called him. He recieved my call and asked me to send him my ID proof. When I asked him why he needs my Id he said as he is on duty, if he wants to go out he has to get written permission from office and as a proof that he is meeting me he needs my Id. I didn't thought much and send him my ID on whatsup. In few minutes He called me and asked me that as scooter is parked in airport cargo yard, I need to submit security amount 3020 rupees to get it out. If I don't like the scooter they will return 3000 rupees. When I asked him how can I trust him he send me photo ID proof of army personnel named Sreekant. Also another person called me introducing himself working in airport cargo office. I trusted him and transferred 3020 using Paytm on provided number by him

Immediately he called me to thank and said he is sending office boy along with scooter as written permission is under process and it may take 10–15 minutes. In few minutes I got call from so called office boy and confirmed that he is in cargo parking and coming with scooter. In next 5 minutes I got call from the same person whom I was dealing with and asked me to submit another 2000 rupees. By now I sensed something fishy but he convinced me by stating himself as an army officer and can't make fraud. I transferred another 2000 rupees

Again in 3–4 minutes I got call from the so called office boy asking me to submit remaining amount to scooter price as it's airport cargo policy. Now I realised that I am being hoaxed. I called the first person and he assured me that he is really working in airport and coming with scooter. He didn't came and again I called him about when he is coming. He tried to convince me that as a airport procedure I need to submit full amount of scooter price and he is submitting 15000 on my behalf and I have to submit 10000. By now I was sure about scam and asked him to return my 5000. He tried to convince me to send him 10000 more and said just check the scooter and refuse to buy it so that cargo office will return full amount. When I refused to transfer that amount and asked him detailed questions about his exact location in airport, he became furious and started abusing me and cut the call. Airport police station was there only so I decided to fill a complaint about this fraud. On speaking with police officer I came to know this is common Scam and so many people lost their hard earned money on such scam. Modus operandi of this gang is citing address of airport in the city. They will introduce themselves as a army personnel and speak very professionally. I request all off them whoever is coming across such adds, please don't transfer a single penny. Report immediately if you come across any such adds.

Thanks for reading this long answer. Do share it so that it reaches to maximum people.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Flipkart - The Biggest Scam!!

I ordered a Flipkart marQ laptop worth 41K Rs in 2020 having 1 year warranty, I started facing issues since day 1.

During order placement product warranty mentioned home resolution for any issues. After few days laptop started showing issues & condition worsened from bad to worse to finally dead state.

I kept on calling customer care & even tried sending emails for home resolution. But forget resolution, they never ever listened to the problem.

Finally after not receiving any support for 1 year I registered the complaint with National Consumer Helpline.

I immediately started receiving callbacks from flipkart team with big sorry for the trouble statements.

I thought finally issue will be resolved, but No!! They started calling after every alternate days but to say the same thing - issue will be resolved shortly. Over the time their tone changed from polite to aggressive and they forced me to close the complain which I refused.

Finally after many long calls and repeated conversations, 1 day I received a call saying please provide your serial no and we will refund you the amount.

I got excited, thanked the guy on call & eagerly waited for Flipkart email. After few minutes I did received the email asking information about laptop. I had the reply ready so I just rechecked the things and clicked send.

Resolved?

No Wait.. mail rejected!!!!!!!!! I tried again.. Failed again :(

Flipkart customer care blocked my email ID :D. I could not reply over that thread any more.

I contacted flipkart again(by raising new issue over customer support), I received a call next day, I was told previous incident has been marked closed since you didn’t replied to the mail on time.

I enquired what is the time, she said 72 hrs, I said its just 24 hrs then, why don’t you capture the information now. But that was not what she was trained for, and the loop began again.

Edit - Thanks guys for the response, haven't expected this much views. Based on suggestions in comments, I have also posted the issue over twitter.

Kuldeep Singh on Twitter

Thanks @vaibhav mathur for suggesting “Flopkart”😀

Thanks again 🙏🙏

Edit2 - Friends, received a call today(31st May) from flipkart social team. I explained the issue again and was hoping for “we will get back to you line”. But instead I have been assured for full refund after product gets picked up(🤓). Feels like deja-vu but not keeping the hopes high this time. Let's see, will keep the thread updated.

Thanks for the support 🙏🙏

Edit3 - (1st June) Flipkart has finally refunded the total amount. 100+ mails, 30+ calls & lot of time was spent to achieve nothing.

Quora and Twitter is the language being understood these days by big giants(knew it, but believed it now). I bow to the power of social media and all people who spent their time reading this answer. Thank you everyone🤗🤗!!

I kept on calling customer care & even tried sending emails for home resolution. But forget resolution, they never ever listened to the problem.

Finally after not receiving any support for 1 year I registered the complaint with National Consumer Helpline.

I immediately started receiving callbacks from flipkart team with big sorry for the trouble statements.

I thought finally issue will be resolved, but No!! They started calling after every alternate days but to say the same thing - issue will be resolved shortly. Over the time their tone changed from polite to aggressive and they forced me to close the complain which I refused.

Finally after many long calls and repeated conversations, 1 day I received a call saying please provide your serial no and we will refund you the amount.

I got excited, thanked the guy on call & eagerly waited for Flipkart email. After few minutes I did received the email asking information about laptop. I had the reply ready so I just rechecked the things and clicked send.

Resolved?

No Wait.. mail rejected!!!!!!!!! I tried again.. Failed again :(

Flipkart customer care blocked my email ID :D. I could not reply over that thread any more.

I contacted flipkart again(by raising new issue over customer support), I received a call next day, I was told previous incident has been marked closed since you didn’t replied to the mail on time.

I enquired what is the time, she said 72 hrs, I said its just 24 hrs then, why don’t you capture the information now. But that was not what she was trained for, and the loop began again.

Edit - Thanks guys for the response, haven't expected this much views. Based on suggestions in comments, I have also posted the issue over twitter.

Kuldeep Singh on Twitter

Thanks @vaibhav mathur for suggesting “Flopkart”😀

Thanks again 🙏🙏

Edit2 - Friends, received a call today(31st May) from flipkart social team. I explained the issue again and was hoping for “we will get back to you line”. But instead I have been assured for full refund after product gets picked up(🤓). Feels like deja-vu but not keeping the hopes high this time. Let's see, will keep the thread updated.

Thanks for the support 🙏🙏

Edit3 - (1st June) Flipkart has finally refunded the total amount. 100+ mails, 30+ calls & lot of time was spent to achieve nothing.

Quora and Twitter is the language being understood these days by big giants(knew it, but believed it now). I bow to the power of social media and all people who spent their time reading this answer. Thank you everyone🤗🤗!!", 'aiModelVersion': '1'}

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
TATA, we all know, is one of the biggest industrial houses in India, known - not only for its products but also transparency, honesty, attachment towards nation and above all, it's customer-friendly service!

However, I had a bit of different experience with them. We often see in most offices, the bosses are helpful but people down the line are not so! When the boss comes to know about the irregularity on the part of his subordinates, he regularises everything.

The same thing happened to me.

Here the boss was TITAN EYE Plus and the subordinate was one of its franchisee.

It all started in June 2014.

I bought two specs from the famous TITAN EYE Plus franchise in Chembur, Mumbai at an approximate cost of about ₹.15,000.

In fact the number of this new spec and of the one I was already using was same. I had bought this new rimless frame only for restrictive use. So in the beginning, I used it only for office and parties!

Eight and a half months passed.

One night when I came home from the office, while keeping this new frame into the box, one of its arm got detached.

Nothing could be done that day but the next day, I came home early from the office and took the glasses to the nearest spec shop. He said, "Sir, a single arm can't be replaced. The whole frame has to be replaced."

"Okay, but still I will visit Titan once.”

He laughed and said, "Sir, it's been eight months since you got these glasses, the guarantee is over. Now no one will entertain you there."

Still, I took an auto and reached Titan.

The shopkeeper heard me, looked at the glasses and said, "Sir, nothing can be done about this. We provide six months' guarantee, nothing more than that. Why not get a new frame, this one will cost you ₹.1,650, and the one here is only for ₹.1,900….”

Reached home and searched for the TITAN EYE website. Somehow, I couldn't find one but found a Titan's page on Facebook. I reported the matter to them. However, I ended my content with this..

IF ONE SPENDS ALMOST RS.10000/=(BILL NO.000000 DT.20.06.14) FOR A BRANDED PRODUCT (IN FACT THAT DAY I BOUGHT TWO PAIRS COSTING AROUND RS.15000/=), CAN'T HE RELY ON THE QUALITY OF THE PRODUCT?
IF THIS IS THE QUALITY OF THE PRODUCT AND CUSTOMER SERVICE, HOW CAN I VISIT TITAN EYE+ SHOWROOM AGAIN?

This was on March 3, 2015.

Next morning, I received a reply from Titan.

‘You have lodged a complaint on the wrong page. But don't worry, we have forwarded it to the right place. You will soon hear from them.’

(March 4, 2015)

The company's mail arrived before noon.

‘Your complaint has been received. Please send a photo of the bill and spectacles for verification.’

(March 4, 2015)

I immediately forwarded both.

Within half an hour or so, there was a feedback.

'We have sent a photo of your spectacles to our laboratory in Ranchi. It will take at least eight days for the report to arrive. Until then, please cooperate with us.’

(March 4, 2015)

Next mail was in another eight days ..

'With reference to the below complaint, please be informed that the replacement of frame is possible for free of cost. Request you to visit the store….’

(March 12, 2015)

In the afternoon, received a phonecall from the showroom,

‘Sir, you will get replacement of the frame from the company at 80 percent discount. Do come in the evening. '

Not agreeing with the requirement to pay, I once again wrote to Titan about the phonecall.

The reply was instantaneous :

‘You don't have to pay anything, please visit the showroom.'

(March 12, 2015)

Visited the showroom in the evening. As soon as I introduced myself, the owner stood up and politely started showing the frames.

There was a big surprise for me.

The company had offered to change not only the frame but also the glasses!

And, finally, on March 28, 2015, I got my new glasses.

While I was looking at the glasses, the owner said,

“Sir, the price of this frame has gone up by ₹.110 since you bought it. "

"What?"

I asked without looking up.

"No no, no problem Sir, we will adjust. Thanks Sir!"

I saw the bill, it was ₹.9,481/-, but I didn't have to pay anything!

On the way home, mailed Titan Eye Plus once again and thanked the company and its employees.

Some notable things emerge out of this story.

Reputed companies like Titan value its customers and it's image more than money! They make no compromises for that. I have deliberately given dates in the reply just to know how fast the action was taken!

On the other side are the shopkeepers (they were Titan's franchisees), who give damn to ordinary customers (there could be respectable exceptions to this!).Their only purpose is to sell goods.

And finally, there are customers like you and me, who do not stand for their right, sometimes out of boredom and often out of ignorance!

Had I not followed up with the Titan, even I would have ended in paying ₹.9,481/=, like a fool!

For one thing, they don't know the power of consumer power!

Thanks

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Movie Theatre scam

I had gone to watch IT movie with my friends in PVR Cinemas. I had checked on BookMyShow application that the movie tickets were priced at Rs. 90 and seats were available so I decided to buy the tickets directly in the theater instead of spending extra money for online booking.

When I reached PVR Cinemas, the tickets seller told me that the cheapest tickets were priced at Rs. 190 . I told her that I had checked the price on BookMyShow which was for Rs. 90 . She didn't listen to me. Moreover I couldn't book from BookMyShow as the window closes 1 hr before movie starts.

I had to give a treat to my friends so I was forced to buy 3 tickets for twice the original price. Then she gave me 3 coupons of Rs. 100 each for popcorn and Pepsi. I realized that she had tricked me and all the other customers to buy the combo offer tickets though we did not want it.

I tried complaining about her to the officials around but they wouldn't listen to me. This is one of biggest scam that I have encountered.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Recently I was travelling from Ahmedabad to Jaipur via bus. So the bus Stopped at around 11 PM somewhere 100 km after Ahmedabad at the hotel/dhaba for dinner.

On the right you can see a general store, so I decided to buy some chips and Chocolate for the journey.

I asked for the 2- 5star(10 Rs) chocolate and a lays chips(20 Rs) packet, So total =40.

He asked for 55 Rs from me. I was like, when did the rate increased. I checked the packet it was 10 and 20 ₹ respectively.

I showed it to the shopkeeper and he strated arguing. He just said, if you want to buy it pay 55₹ or else leave. As a passenger we are pretty much bound to such dhaba and shops when bus stops at such places in night. Finally I took it for 55₹ and started to observe the shopkeeper standing there. I found out that the shopkeeper was charging 5₹ extra to every product on the MRP.

Rough calculation.

Let say on an average 20 buses stops in a day at that particular shop. From which 10 passenger from each bus buys a single product.

Total product=> 20*10= 200

Total benefit=> 200*5= 1000 + margin on every product depending upon its MRP.

This is just an average figure.

Similar type of incident took place with me, when I was travelling from ISBT kashmiri gate to Hamirpur, Himachal Pradesh.

This is type of scam which goes on every day at almost every such dhabas and shops .

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
US consulate Chennai, India

Yes, you heard it right. The scam is happening in the US consulate too.

Recently, I went for my H1B stamping in Chennai, previously I have been to consulate stamping for almost 4 times. So I consider myself that I knew process and procedure for US visa stamping.

Usually, on the first day, there will biometric, where they will take your photo and fingerprints, and on a second-day visa interview, both are in different locations. Similarly, my biometric was done and while I was about to leave, the lady in counter who took my photo and fingerprint told me.

lady: Sir, please take two copies of your photo for the US visa interview tomorrow.

me: What!! I have been to consulate 4 times before, and I have never taken any photo, why is this time?

lady: (looked scared) Sir, the system has some problem and we are not able to take photos properly.

me: then what did you do just now, you took my photo and fingerprint.

lady: (Really scared) Sir, I don’t know all that, you have to take a photo. Photoshop is in downstairs.

me: ok, thank you.

I left consulate office, while coming down I saw a long queue for US visa photos downstairs, and thought of taking the photo there (as I am not aware of Chennai much).

They charged Rs.250 for 2 photos. I was like, okay that fine, waited for almost an hour to get my photo there and left.

The next day morning I had my interview in a different location and I took all my documents and photos too. To my surprise, they never asked for any photos for anyone. Once I came back to my hotel room. It flashed to my brain, that I never gave photos, later when I recapped all incidents of the lady in counter getting scared, I concluded this is a scam happening in the US consulate.

Every day in the Chennai consulate around 1000 people come for stamping, everyone takes photos there, and people don’t mind paying Rs.250 as it is a small amount. But this is free money for them, they make almost Rs.2,50,000 in the day.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This is a very common scam that I've seen many big brands use to sell their products…

Same brand, same flavor.. . Correct?

Same manufacturing month/year - 04/22.. correct?

Now check the price & quantity.. Buy 1 get 1 (free) is ₹190/- for 700ml so you'll get one extra, that is 700ml + 700ml = 1400ml. Now the other (regular pack with no offer) is priced at ₹110/- for 900ml. Let's do the math ; ₹190/- divided by 14 (1400ml) = ₹13.57 for 100ml and ₹110/- divided by 9 (900ml) = ₹12.22 for 100ml!! So basically you are paying more for buying a product with discount offer!!!

I've seen the same scam with other brands & products, like biscuits, dosa batter, yogurt, chips & other snacks.

* EDIT *

Thank you all for your upvotes & thanks 🙏

I did not expect so many views & responses 😃

There are many people commenting that this is not a scam but a marketing technique,... I agree that this is not a direct scam but an unethical marketing strategy not less to a scam.

I also agree that nobody is being forced to buy it, but let me tell you... Generally both packs, with offer pack & without offer pack are not made available in the same store at the same time for the reason that if a customer by chance notices both packs & does a comparison (like I did) they will realise that they are being hoodwinked. Here the manufacturer is trying to make the customer believe that they are buying a product at a discounted rate & getting extra while in reality they are paying more for the same product which is available for a lesser price.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Ola cab drivers cancelling the ride after passenger boards the cab, after confirming that he will be paid by cash for the ride.

This happened yesterday as I booked a cab for myself and a colleague to chennai domestic airport. Firstly the cab didn't arrive at my pickup place, but the ola app showed that cab has arrived.

Screenshot of the same:

Then I recieved a call from cab driver asking for payment mode I chose while booking. As it was not cash, he said to cancel the ride for which I will have to bear cancelling charges. I asked him to cancel as he denied the ride, he disconnected the call and didn't answer my call when I tried calling him back. I didn't have any other options apart form cancelling it.

After that I booked another OLA cab with payment mode as cash, as we didn't want to arrive late, to the airport. The cab arrived and we got in. I told the OTP and kept my phone in the bag. I started discussing office related work with my colleague. Meanwhile the cab driver noticed that both of us are in some discussion, he asked what was the amount showed for the ride when I booked. I thought he was asking casually and told the amount. He took advantage of our discussion and cancelled the ride. I couldn't notice as he kept his phone in hand and typing as he didn't have mobile holder with him.

He started google maps and drove to airport. When we reached he acted weird and asked for the money and I gave him as I knew the amount, he was hiding his phone and came out from the cab to take out luggage. When I checked the OLA app to give rating, I saw that he has cancelled the ride.

Literally he is cheating the OLA and the customers. I wonder how he has 4.9 rating.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Few months back I got a surprising call from a girl. After talking to her for 2 mins I came to know that she was my college senior. Though I have talked to her in the past, once or twice but nothing major.

So, a random call from her did surprise me. Here's how the conversation went.

She - Hey how are you, you have forgotten me completely, you don't call ?

Me -( I'm just an average looking guy, and I know it's impossible that out of nowhere a girl will call me and without any motive would talk to me.)

Nothing like that ….I was .. little busy.

So this conversation went on for half an hour, And to be honest I was also enjoying this little chit chat. Who won't, these calls and messages became daily routine for me.

Every now and then she would call and ask me if I like my job , if I'm content , whether I have some ambitions or not.

Though this things did sound a little strange at first, but then who wouldn't like a little chit chat with a beautiful girl after a hectic day in office.

Slowly she started discussing her future plans with me. How desperate she is to buy Audi, new home, want to retire before 40 and stuff like this.

All this sounded little fishy, but I played along. I wanted to know where this thing is going to lead me.

So, this fling continued for a month and suddenly she said to me that a position has just popped up in her organization and she wants to hire a dedicated, workaholic, creative person. Till now I was listening to her patiently, but then she crossed all the limits when she said I possess all the qualities which she mentioned above!

Now here is the thing, the way she was sounding, it was too good to be true. Man, this much my mom doesn't praise me in front of my neighbors . Now I was certain that definitely there is something wrong with this girl.

So finally on the D-day she revealed the big secret, that I will have to Invest 2.5 lac in her business, so that I can buy Audi for my parents.

For next few days I just kept telling her I would think about it, I would invest in little while. I didn't want to tell her straight that I know what kind of bullshit she is trying to sell me but I ain't stupid enough to buy it.

Finally she got frustrated and asked me whether I would invest or not ?

I told her to focus on her job and… Hello...? Hello…?

Well I couldn't complete and she blocked me from everywhere.

P.S- I wrote this answer to spread some awareness among my peers. Please don't get fooled by these kind of thugs. There is no shortcut to success. I have seen people around me getting decieved and wasting their hard earned money and regretting later. You can't buy Audi by investing 2.5 lacs on some random idiotic dumb scheme.

This business could be anything Q-net,E-biz, Amway they come in different masks but their only agenda is to fool you by selling you dreams. Be smart and know the difference between investment and Ponzi schemes.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This time it's Paytm.

Let me introduce the issue.

I have ordered AnyCast WiFi HDMI dongle from Paytm which clearly mentioned it is AnyCast M2 Miracast device.

Upon receiving the item, I came to know the product was of different brand and it seemed used. The shipping box also had invoices of previous order of this same product and it may have returned before.

I wanted to be replaced with original for which I have paid. So, I raised a query regarding it.

The response I got from Paytm representative was completely unimaginable.

I was surprised when he told product can be of any brand as it was imported.

What a clueless answer by Paytm.

I asked for his name for giving such a worst reply, so that I could post it social media for endorsing fake products from other brand.

Now, I found something unusual, instead of giving his name, the representative wanted to end this query by applying a strategy. He told me there is duplicate query running on their system for this order.

Who the hell created this another query. I couldn’t find any query ending with 6339 in my Paytm ticket history. This was a plan to quit me from responding.

I replied back them that I don’t have any such duplicate ticket in my history. Please stick to this query only, but again I got the same reply in response with ‘TICKET CLOSED’ and Return Rejected.

Now I couldn’t track that ticket 46556339 even by tweeting to Paytm nor do they reply to above query even after 20 days.

I know the issue of sending duplicate item was from seller but I am quite unsatisfied with the resolution given to me by Paytm and they are endorsing to sell duplicate items by this way. They should have taken action against seller.

Note : It may be pretty uncommon right now but going to be common scam ahead.

Update: Finally Paytm has approved return and refunded after a month. Thank you Quorans!

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
ONLINE FOOD DELIVERY

I noticed that I’ve become a regular customer of online food delivery companies ,be it Zomato or Swiggy lately and I believe there would be so many people like me who feel the ease of getting readymade foods delivered home. For a person who works and cooks , its a boon sometimes.But what we need to understand carefully is that these companies are making fools out of people’s need. I normally order food from trusted restaurant specially where I have been to. But what I realised that there’s a huge difference in taste and quality between dining in the restaurant and getting food delivered from the same restaurant. These companies, most of the times come up with attractive offers and deals and in return serves stale food from its partner restaurants. People get trapped with such deals without even realising . Let me share my experience today.

I received fungus(mold) filled gujia from the trusted brand Bikanerwala through Zomato,upon complaining they offered an apology and the refund.just look at the pictures,

Questions: What is a major scam in India?
Answers:
Today Me and my wife went to GIANIS in west delhi.

Today you will notice a different type of fraud which we people generally (who often go for food in restaurants, stores ..) Don’t notice. It is something that we usually ignore and straight away see the prices and then pay the bill. BUT BEFORE YOU DO IT NEXT TIME , HAVE A LOOK AT WHAT HAPPENED WITH ME.

Conversation was like this between me, my wife and Gianis counter boy -

Me - what is the price for Belgian chocolate ice cream?

Counter Boy- Sir, ₹80 per scoop

Me - Give me 2 scoops in Cone.

My wife- I want one scoop of punjabi delight in cone.

Me - How much to pay?

Counter boy-₹310

Me - Bit confused ( I know Gianis ice cream are costly)but then I paid ₹310.

We were enjoying our ice cream, our house is on 10min walking distance from Gianis, so, I asked her to let’s eat while walking, she declined and said it’s too hot outside so let’s finish it here. I said .. ok and after 5min she asked me how much did your ice cream cost? I said ₹160.

She was like how come the bill be of ₹310 then. (Her scoop was ₹70–75) .Then she saw the bill (understood that they cheated us) and asked counter boy, conversations were like-

My wife- How did it cost ₹310?

Counter boy- mam, ₹160 double scoop and ₹75 your single scoop and ₹10 per cone.

My wife- Total is still ₹255. How did you charge ₹310?

Counter boy- (scared, thinking what to say) .. Mam there is some confusion . Sorry mam. It happened by mistake.

It all happened when there was no other customer in the store. He knowingly added a higher price item to increase the bill.Otherwise how could he add banana shake when we both were just standing next to him having icecream . + he asked his staff about our food items in front of us and they simply told him. Still he added something else that costed us somewhat double. However, he gave me back ₹55 after this
.
.

So , like a aware person check not only the price but the Food Item that they added in your bill.

Happy reading!!!

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Hospital scams

My brother was admitted in Sunrise hospital Rohini Delhi. He was suffering from dengue and then weakness.

Here doctors priscribe unnecessary tests .. costly medicines.

Example they give curezone injection which cost whooping Rs 535.00.

Same salt composition in renowed pharma company is available at Rs 60.

They write locally rebranded medicines like Rabzen , cunext 100.

They were giving almost same medicines to all patients.

These medicines are available only at hospital chemist shop. You cant find them at any good chemist shop.

Every day i was forced to buy medicines of Rs 3000 .The hospital chemist never gave discount of single Rs.

A normal USG of KUB cost Rs 800-1000 in market. But they force us to get it done at Nasa rohini which charges Rs1800 for same.

I spent 21000 only on medicines. And 15600 as bed fee. 3600 for USG ( they told us to do it twice ) 5700 for differnt tests . For 6 days

The doctors ( espcially senior MD) never even touch the patients.

The day before discharge i asked the doctor about progress of my brother. As medicines were not working. He was still suffering from high fever. The senior doctor told me “ bahut internal problems h. Fir se KUB USG krao” . He wrote same medicines again.

He just see the reports and suggests new test.

When i consulted with our Army doctor ( my dad is in Indian army ) . He told us that there is nothing serious. No more test is required . Take the discharge.

Why some doctors play with patient's health. This is very common scam atleast in Delhi.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Neeta Travel Hinjewadi Pune.

I am not sure if every Neeta travels does the same or not, but this one branch sure scam people. Please do not book ticket from Neeta travels hinjewadi Pune.

Let me tell you the scam part :

As I had to catch a flight from Mumbai at 1 p.m, I booked a ticket from Pune to Mumbai at 7 a.m same day. One night before my journey date, I received a call from Neeta Travels that my bus has been cancelled and they want me to shift in another bus at a later time. I asked them to cancel my ticket instead and refund me. The guy agreed and cut the phone.

Later on I booked ticket from another travels and went to Mumbai. A few days after that when I checked for my refund, I was shocked to see that bus was not cancelled and rebus was showing my journey as completed. When I called them and asked about this they said they don’t have any information about bus cancellation and as per Neeta travels, I boarded the bus and traveled to Mumbai so there was no question of refunding my money.

Luckily I had ticket from other travels too, so I showed them both the tickets and asked how is it possible for me to travel in two different buses on same day at almost same time. They checked and accepted their mistake and returned my money.

Today same thing happened with my friend too and I couldn't stop myself from writing about it this time.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
I recently quit my job because I did not like what I was doing and wanted a change of profession . I registered myself on Shine(A place where you can view and apply jobs ,very similar to Indeed and Naukri) .

The very next day I get a mail from TATA Group of Companies with an interview call letter . I was surprised as I hadn't applied for any jobs and had just created an account . I opened the E Mail and was in for a few surprises ,

1st Red Flag :: Download link seemed suspicious ,looked more of a file sharing website.

Now going to the contents of the letter

No mention of the position I had been selected for screening , just a generic link to careers of the website .
“ As per your Designation, your starting salary will be (Rs. 59, 689, -To Rs. 7,45,689) per month in hand. “ - Well I hadn't discussed anything .
“ Normal working hours are 09:00AM to 5PM Monday to Friday. Saturday and Sunday are holidays. “ - I laughed at this .
“ If you want to go London so for the further details you just contact to Human Resources Manager “ - Fake promise to take you to London
“ Your Interview Process will be held at Company Office. Venue: Sector 13-M Block A-263, Selaqui Industrial Area, Selakui, Dehradun Uttarakhand 248011 India. Date:- 24th of September 2018. Time:-11:30 AM To 04:30 PM. “ - The address is hoax .
The Main Part - “

(So follow these company Rules and Regulations) (Mandatory): - The Candidate have to Deposit a Refundable Interview Processing & Maintenance & Courier & Accommodation & Assurance charges Rs. Eight Thousand Two Hundred Ninety Nine Rupees (8,299, -with GST) by down payment only on 10-09-2018 before 04:00 Pm in Favor of Tata Group Of Companies Ltd . by

Paytm Wallet (5% Cashback on Paytm Wallet) - LOL ( Cashback ) “ If you want to pay the amount by the Paytm Wallet so just Add the Sufficient amount in your Paytm Wallet, and just contact to your Human Resource Manager – Dr. Ashutosh Anand. for the Paytm Number or QR Code / Bank Account Number. “
By Debit Card
TEZ and other UPI

I feel for all those unemployed people who are desperate and fall for these .

Edit - I thought it would help some people if awareness is spread. Keep in mind a few things I have listed below , some are from my own experience and few I have picked online .

1.Never pay money upfront - employers and agencies should pay you, not the other way round.

2.Always do your Homework - Be very wary if you are offered a job you did not apply for out of the blue from a person you do not know, and without any interview or meeting. If in any doubt, always check out the company supposedly advertising the job, verify the phone number on the company website and call the employer to check the job exists. Other tell-tale signs of fraud could be poorly written job adverts, and generic email addresses (such as Hotmail or Gmail) that can’t be traced to a business.

3.Never agree to phone a would-be employer for an interview - If an employer wants you to work for them, they will call you.

4.Never provide private details up front – any requests for personal data ahead of an interview or registration meeting (if an agency) should be treated with suspicion. Until you have the job, keep your bank details safe and only provide identity details once you have met face to face.

5. Make sure there is a Job Description - Legit call letters will have Job Description and will not be generic .

6. Be cautious of emails with grammatical and spelling mistakes - Legit Call letters are written by professionals . Does the language used in the posting sound odd or strangely written, if yes its red flags .

7. Jobs through Social Media - Never trust any job offers received through Facebook , Insta .

8.Never pay to access a hidden job market- Avoid making payments for getting a premium account at any job portal .

9. Check for complaints - When suspicious search online , there will be other people who would have posted about the same .

Amazing job opportunities don’t usually just fall into your lap or into your inbox. If it seems to good to be true use your best judgment.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Electronics Repair Shops.

Most of them are total scammers and take advantage of people’s ignorance and charge exponential amount for even a small repair work by making up stories.

First Incident :

One day our TV stopped working. I went to local repair shop and asked how much will it cost to repair TV and he(technician) with smile on his face replied, “Sir ji sirf Rs.4000 kyunki tv ka motherboard aur power supply board kharab ho gaya”(“Only Rs. 4000 as motherboard and power supply board are completely damaged.”). Checked some electronics repair forums and a couple of YouTube videos later I got to know that it was a very common problem with LCD TVs and the main culprit for TV problem was not damaged motherboard or power supply but leaked Capacitors. Went to an electronics shop and bought two capacitors which cost only Rs.5 each. TV started working fine after replacing damaged capacitors.

That TV repair guy was charging Rs. 4000 for something which could have been repaired for just Rs. 10!

Note: You can easily spot damaged capacitors, they look bloated and in some cases they also leak.(In below pic one cannot see the bloated top as I pressed it just to see if it worked, it did not :P)

Second Incident :

My Laptop was overheating and because of that it was constantly switching off by itself. went to computer repair shop and guy there started telling me that there is a problem with temperature sensor + cooling fan and replacing it will set me back cool Rs. 2500/-. Went home and grabbed Phillips screwdriver, opened a laptop and found a chunk of dust in cooling fan which was blocking the airflow near heat sink. Cleaned it and problem was Solved. Cost = Zero.

So friends, whenever you face some problem with your electronics gadgets then do try to find out what may be the cause of a problem and do not trust technicians blindly. They will overcharge from you for sure.

Edit: Read more such incidents in comment section below.

All technicians are not scammers but most of them are.

Caution:

Repairing electronics is dangerous.

If you don’t know how to solder/de-solder, check polarity, use multi-meter and general stuff of that sort then refrain yourself from tinkering with them cause you might end up further damaging the device or might as well get yourself injured.
BE SAFE :)

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Instagram scam.

You might have heard many types of scams but have you ever listened to Instagram scam? That is based purely on Instagram.

Let me explain you a incident that happened to my own brother.

My brother while scrolling his Insta feed, he came across a page that was selling mobiles for cheap rates.

I will share some screenshots that I took in my mobile

My brother got excited because he always wanted to buy iPhone Xs.

After seeing this one, he texted them and asked for the details.

At first they told him that there is no COD available, and should pay all the money in advance.

But my brother bargained with them... so They told my brother that, my brother should pay 500 rupees as advance then the rest of the amount can be paid after the delivery(my brother thought the seller must be very kind).

He even told that the delivery will be placed through amazon and will be getting regular updates in Amazon account.

My brother felt happy, even though I told him that it's all scam, he went on.

In my brother's voice…. he told me that 500 is not a big deal and wanted to try his luck.

My brother sent him money through online payment, and waited for the delivery date.

But all he got was nothing… after a day he was blocked from Instagram. My brother thought something was wrong so I checked in my account and it was opening fine. That's when I understood my brother was cheated.

I sent him request and sent him message too but I was also blocked by them. (Must be seen that my brother and me are having mutual friendlist)

So, what's the common scam?

Fooling people with the Instagram.

There were many people who were cheated like this, and still people are believing in them.

I don't understand how can someone sell a phone for 1500 which will be about 75k?

They are good at manipulating.

They say that only few pieces are available and we should hurry up.
We should pay some money to book the product or else it will be taken by someone else
They will deliver through amazon or flipkart that way citing they are genuine.
They will show some fake delivery status, and post it online.
Their own men does comment on their posts, saying they got the product and it's the best website ever. But trust me it's not.
Once you pay him, they will block you.
Even if they tell that COD is available, don't trust them because they will send some soapbox Instead of mobile phones.
In no way you can trace them nor you can find them, all your hard earned money will be lost.

If you were thinking there were only one or two such pages, you are mistaken. There were many such pages.

There were many other things which they pretend to sell, that includes… power bank, backpacks, pouches, shoes, chappals, earphones, headphones. What not everything.

Next time if you ever come across such pages, don't give it a try.

Thank you for reading. Have a nice day.

Edit:

Wow I never realised the power of Quora, I thought only to bring awareness but I didn't expect anything in return.

But guess what? The one who cheated have texted my brother, requesting him to delete the answer.

This time he renamed his display name as @hana_kuma21.

(Deleted all the posts, and even removed the display pic. So that no one can find him)

At first he told that he will return the money, then he told that he will give the actual iPhone mobile and Apple watch.

This time I told my brother not to trust him, but he requested and even told us that he will send the money to our address.

We wanted to see what he gonna do, so intentionally we gave him wrong address.

And very little did I known that these scammers are more intelligent and manipulative than us…

He has told that he created a email id and created a account in Amazon.

(Now here is the point, we may think it as true… but the thing is… the email-id is invalid.

There is a website which can create 10 minute mail. after 10 minutes, it gets deleted on its own.

So he created such mail and he used it as Amazon account… you can see 0hcow.com
 which is neither a e.mail one or any website.

And look at the password… for any password there has to be atleast 8 words… but he only sent 6(you123). Thinking that we can't Identify all of it)

Still we acted as if we trust him, he also told that he gave the order of iPhone and watch on Amazon.

He even sent us his credit card.

When we asked for screenshot, he sent us this….

It was indeed ordered, so I thought how it's possible or is he serious about it?

We are thinking what he gonna scam us now, still we had no idea.

Till then he requested us every other day to delete the Quora post. (I never knew a single post can scare a person to such extent)

I declined him, and I said I will do only if I got the mobile (actually I won't delete this post, even if I got the mobile)

He even sent the tracking, saying that he is indeed genuine.

And then he started blackmailing us that, he will cancel the order unless or untill we delete the post.

Now there is no guarantee that he will deliver the package once if I give up. So stood firm and told him that am not gonna delete the post.

More than anything, I was only determined to bring awareness.

I got an idea and we called Amazon customer care… we have given the track order I'd… and asked him about the status… the person on the other end told me that This order got cancelled on the day 1 itself.

Then everything made sense to me, he indeed ordered, but carefully cancelled so that we shouldn't get fooled.

He thought that we will delete the post, once we see the tracking process.

So, What did I learn today?

Don't believe in those tracking process, they can be taken from past other orders too.
Don't give your original address, you may never know what gonna follow next.
No person will give us 1 lakh mobile for free.
Never pay a single rupee till you see the actual product.

And now we have decided to file a complaint in cybercrime police station. Atleast they will find him and punish him.

Now can anyone please tell me, why is he so scared of this Quora post?

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Last year I was traveling in Shatabdi express for the first time from Puri to Kolkata.

(pic credit:Google)

I was little bit excited too, as I don't travel by train much.

We were served with breakfast as it was included in the ticket cost. Then at the time of lunch, the same was served. While the quality of the food was far below the average, the scam wasn't this.

Now after we finished the lunch, one of the Pantry guy came with a tray in which he had a box with saunf (fennel seeds) which we Indians generally consume after lunch / dinner.

And apart from the saunf part, the tray had few Rs. 2000/- and many Rs. 500/- Rs. And very few Rs. 200/- notes.

I was observing that, pantry guy was going each and every seat to offer saunf, but seeing money in the tray, all the passengers also started to put money in the tray as a tip.

Now since the tray only had high denomination notes and normally a person traveling In Shatabdi is well to do, mostly everyone was putting at least Rs. 500/- and a few people put Rs. 200/- notes.

These pantry guys themselves put these high denomination notes so that other passengers would think that it's a tip that everybody is giving.

Just imagine the amount they are making inadvertently everyday.

Also read

Govinda Agrawal's answer to What are the biggest scams and frauds today?

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This happened around a year ago when I tried to change my broadband to Hathway. I filled the form on their website and the very next day got a call from their service team that it is not feasible in my locality.

But after 2–3 hrs I got another call that the visit is scheduled at my location when I informed about non-feasibility in my locality he convinced me that it is feasible and called few names in my area to which he recently provided connection. So, I asked him to visit on the weekend for my availability.

On Saturday, 2 Hathway professionally dressed guys visited my home and informed me of the plan and convinced me for a 3-month advance payment plan of 2400 with an additional month discount and free router.

Me: Do you have any pamphlet or any brochure?

Him: No, you can verify the plan online we do not have paper works.

Me: (With a bit doubt)Okay, How Can I make the payment?

Him: Cash will be faster i.e. by today we’ll be able to process router request and other things. If by cheque it may take 4–5 working days.

Me: Okay there is no hurry, I’ll go with the cheque.

Him: Sir why going the old way, in case if clearance delays offer may get expired I always prefer cash and quick work.

Me: But giving cash in advance without any proof doesn't make me confident.

Him: Sir its a company work, you’ll get the receipt and by evening we’ll get router connected.

Me: I agree. Paid cash and got the receipt.

Him: Sir do you have any other reference in the nearby area so that we can make some extra and you’ll get a month rewarded.

Me: Yes have two friends looking to change broadband and given the contact info to them.

and they left…

I confirmed my friends but they didn't got call. I tried calling them in the evening but it was switched off. Tried calling on Monday, Tuesday for few continuous day but I finally got to know that I was being cheated.

After a month and after thinking I thought to repeat the process, again filled the Hathway form with a different name, mobile, address in the locality. after a few hours got the call that not feasible in my area.

But Interestingly to my surprise I again got call visit to be scheduled as its feasible in my area. Now here I was one step forward than the cheaters :)

After the same scheme info and everything, I asked them to come near a shop and got 4–5 my friends ready to raid them. And finally, it happened they cam we raided, beaten when they tried to dominate, took their mobile phones and after they understood no way out they accepted.

Now the real game begins, We called the police and for calling 20+ time the Delhi police didn’t come even after waiting 3 hours and calling again and again.

We loosen the cheater to check what they do and they ran, we let them run. Never get call from police and cheaters left their mobile with us. We went to police station to file a complaint to which police guy was very happy to see 2 mobiles coming in his pocket. He asked us to write on piece of paper the incident and submit the phones. We did and even after asking for acknowledgment he didn’t gave and started threatening us for looting phone seriously.

So, I finally meet with 2 kind of fraudesters - White collar POLICE and the cheaters.

Questions: What are the scams happening in India now?
Answers:
I saw this ad on Instagram. They were selling this suit:

Being a fan of this colour, I decided to order it.

The price was unbelievable. ₹699. I thought even if the quality doesn’t turn out to be not that great, I can use it for daily wear if not for parties. I kept my order as COD to be sure.

I would also like to mention here that I had purchased a lehenga from an Instagram store back in 2017 and it turned it to be amazing. That was also just for ₹2000. It is good for a fully stitched piece in tafetta silk.

I was very satisfied with that purchase and hence decided to go forward with this one too.

I received a mail of order confirmation. No communication thereafter. We generally get a lot of mails while buying things online. This made me feel a little suspicious.

I let it be thinking they are a new homegrown brand and they won’t be having systems like that of amazon and Myntra in place.

The product I received was this:

This is such a poor quality fabric. I won’t buy it for a ₹100 and I ended up paying ₹699 for this.

I mailed them. No response.

I have talked to the consumer redressal forum. I won’t let them get away with this.

I feel hurt at such practices.

There’s so much more to this.

A brand created trust. Another one broke it.

Now I will probably not trust even a genuine homegrown business. I will not get amazing deals like the lehenga. They will not get business from me.

This is the problem with such scams.

They distort the economy.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
*'NEW HOTEL SCAM!!*

This is one of the smartest scams I have heard about.

You arrive at your hotel and check in at the front desk. Typically when checking in, you give the front desk your credit card (for any charges to your room) and they don't retain the card.

You go to your room and settle in. All is good.

The hotel receives a call and the caller asks for (as an example) *room 620* - which happens to be your room.

The phone rings in your room. You answer and the person on the other end says the following:

*'This is the front desk. When checking in, we came across a problem with your charge card information.*

*Please re-read me your credit card numbers and verify the last 3 digits numbers at the reverse side of your charge card.'*

Not thinking anything wrong, since the call seems to come from the front desk you oblige. But actually, *it is a scam by someone calling from outside the hotel*. They have asked for a *random room number*, then *ask you for your credit card and address information.*

*They sound so professional, that you think you are talking to the front desk.*

If you ever encounter this scenario on your travels, *tell the caller that you will be down to the front desk to clear up any problems.*

Then, *go to the front desk or call directly and ask if there was a problem.*

If there was none, *inform the manager of the hotel that someone tried to scam you of your credit card information, acting like a front desk employee.*

This was sent by someone who has been duped........

and is still cleaning up the mess.

*P.S.*

Please, consider spreading the word by forwarding this msg.

Who knows, you might just help someone avoid a nasty experience.

*Whoever are traveling often should be aware of this one!*

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Recently I got scammed by Zomato. Actually on 31st August 2023 I had ordered Mushroom biryani at 8:07pm from Zomato Gold (Membership ) & as per their norms, they claim on time delivery and if not then you are eligible to claim a coupon of up to 100% of your order value under the On Time Guarantee policy. So order delivery time was showing was 9:07pm.

Suddenly it started raining here, then I got notification from Zomato that Since your order couldn't be delivered by 09:07 pm, you are eligible to claim a coupon of up to 100% of your order value under the On Time Guarantee policy. You can claim the coupon from the app once the order is delivered.

Now the delivery partner came at 11:15pm, I took my order & then I started searching for Coupon which It was not featuring. While chatting with Customer care they said that Since our delivery partner reached within 100 metres of your delivery location before promised time of 09:07pm, this order is not eligible for On Time Guarantee claim. Can you believe how this people scams to their customers. I raised my complaint to them on mail, also twitted this matter by tagging them but did not got any response. After 1 hr of war they release a coupon which was of 130 Rs. and my Oder was of 307/-

It’s not about getting a free coupon, but it is about the trust which has been created in customer’s mind by doing a lot of Advertisements.
