Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This!

The Scams by Hotels in India (The image is of actual hotel)!

This happened with me during my recent visit to kanpur for some office work. It's a well known semi luxury hotel situated in city. Now the scam part:

Incident goes like this, During check in, one of the guys at counter informed me about an additional charges which I have to paid for, considering this booking was done by my company & whole amount was already paid (like in general for any stay), I had a little doubt over these additional unpaid charges. At that day as I was in a hurry due to the work, I left this to resolve during my check out. Here is my stay receipt:

Now here comes my communication with one of their staff at reception during checkout:

Staff: Started with the cliche hospitality gestures & asked to rate on OYO.

Me: Thank you, will do. Any amount due here to pay (I know I have not ordered anything in hotel, still asked just for clarification)

Staff: Sir, wait for the bill. Now here comes the bill which mention Rs 168 as unpaid for the stay!

I had tried to convince him that the whole amount of stay which was mentioned in OYO was paid already & have re confirmed with my office for the same. Now here comes the trick part:

Staff: Sir, actually the booking amount mentioned in oyo was 13×× while our minimum booking starts at 14××. This is why as we have tried to generate the bill, it is taking the minimum booking amount & due to this you have to pay the extra amount.

Me: Surprised! I know that they have just consumed my 10-15 minutes as I know how to resolve this, thanks to my frequent travellings. I first just try to put him down logically.

Me: See, it doesn't matter to me whatever your minimum booking amount is as I had booked it through oyo & have already paid what they have asked. I will not pay this amount in any case. I have asked him to re check.

Staff: Sir but this is the unpaid amount to be cleared before check out.

Me: See you can change your minimum booking amount to a hundred thousand rupees, but I will only pay for what I have booked for (with a little anger, which I rarely show in my real life).

Staff: Sir, we will provide you a bill copy for the same. And he was with a printed bill!

Me: I will get the bill copy on mail from oyo, this bill is not a necessary (I am sure they have printed the bill by tampering the original bill).

No assistance from staff, still they continously trying to request me to pay. I have told them that if amount was genuine I was ready to pay even 2K, but it was just a fraud amount which they have presented.

Now in the last, I have called to OYO helpline & after confirming my booking ID, the customer care representative requested me to give the line to the reception staff. The moment I told them that this is consumer care of oyo, they have accepted the mistake & requested me to cut the line.

Staff: Now some well suited man (most probably the manager) came there & tell me that it was a printing mistake from one of their staff & upon re checking they have found that no unpaid amount is there to pay!

So what I have learned here is:

They were fraud charging this additional amount which was not in the bill.
As the amount was nominal, even half of the public will pay to avoid any delay (as in case one have to catch bus/train he couldn't resist them due to time constraint & would simply pay)
I am not sure whether this amount is shared by their staff in between, or this is actually a cheap sale trick by the hotel itself.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Incident 1:
(Story: There’s a case filed against you. Pay up, or go to jail.)

Got this call yesterday, from a lady:

Lady: Tushar Dwivedi speaking?
Me: Yes.

Lady: I am calling from Delhi Consumer court, information department. We have got a case filed against you, in section 420, for money laundering.
Me:(thinking… money laundering case, that too in consumer court, that too under section 420, thought to play along) Okay, who has filed the complain?

Lady: I can’t tell you that. I am giving you party’s number. You can call them, give my reference, and settle the case, if you want.
Me: Anyways, I am already talking to you. Why don’t you simply tell me what is the complain, and who has filed it? Moreover, who are you?

Lady: I am Pooja.
Me: Who Pooja?

Lady: I am lawyer’s assistant.
Me: Which lawyer?

Lady: From Delhi consumer court, information department.
Me: Yes, yes, that’s okay. But there must be some name of the lawyer, right? He must have some name registered in school as child, and also with Bar council.

Lady: Ayeee… Why are you wasting my time? Tell me if you want to do settlement or not? I will send it to legal cell, and you will be arrested in no time. I can get the case settled for nominal fees, later you will have to pay a few lacs. I am sending you a legal notice, nothing can happen after that.

Me: Sure mam, send me a notice. And why only police, send army as well. Neither I own any business, nor any shop. Still consumer forum is giving me so much respect, and filing case under shiny sections of money laundering. Please go ahead, so that my name also comes in news with big people. Or may be, call your friends in Tees Hazari court(another name these scammers use frequently), and get 1–2 cases related to Panama papers as well. That will be more fun. Anyways, I hope you already know that I know who you are.

(Call disconnected)

I called back a few times to tease her, as I was free. But the number was busy. She was working with next victim without wasting a minute.

Checked on true caller:
Name: Delhi Court
255 spam reports

Thought of looking up on google, to understand it in more detail(was already sure, it’s a scam, by now)

Found this:
Citizens get fraud calls related to consumer court cases - Times of India

A scam that is going on for almost 4 years, but somehow I hadn’t heard of it, unlike all the other credit card CVV-OTP, kind of scams. But turns out these people, actually end up asking for big amounts, in the name of escaping legal troubles of a non-existing case.

Posted it on facebook first in Hindi, and today writing a translated version on Quora, for the same.

(I have removed reference to my other answer & my facebook post, as this answer was flagged by Quora moderation, as a SPAM answer. As they don’t tell the reason, it’s all just guess work to decide what exactly they considered as SPAM)

Incident 2:
(Story: Pay our fake telecom bills, or we are filing a 420 case on you. Indian courts are shitty, and whatever proofs you might have, are useless, so we will win, and you got to Jail)

Another thing that worths mentioning here, is that such calls are also done by petty collection agents, imposing as lawyers, which are hired by local telecom companies, etc.

I have once ended up paying 2 months rental for an internet connection, that I had already requested to be cancelled, as I was not much careful back then. But soon realised that it’s a common trend in such companies to make up fake bills, and then while knowing that they can’t really do anything legally, paying money to collection agents to scam people, and threaten them of fake police cases, to get the money. Got a few such calls again, every time I asked any company to close my account. And now I just enjoy pulling their legs, if I have time, and just throwing a few abuses, and disconnecting, if I am busy.

Update: I have written about this incident, in further detail, in below answer.

(I have removed reference to my other answer & my facebook post, as this answer was flagged by Quora moderation, as a SPAM answer. As they don’t tell the reason, it’s all just guess work to decide what exactly they considered as SPAM)

Silly me, if you read this answer, you will realise that the time I wrote that answer, I actually paid them the money, and I even believed that Tikona had actually filed a case against me. I guess, there are few things, you can just learn from experience.

Incident 3:
(Story: Come to the police station, or we will come and arrest you. Ok I am coming, which police station? Didn’t think of the name)

I have even received one call from someone claiming to be calling from police station recently, asking me to reach the nearby police station ASAP, as there’s a complain against me for eve-teasing in market yesterday. Imagine getting such call, while lot of genuine/fake #MeToo stories floating around. :D

Moreover, I was on sick leave for last 4 days. I asked them, which market, and how did they get my number, even if I have done something like this. I also asked to tell them the name of police station, I need to come to.

They didn’t give any answer, and rather started yelling at me that they will send someone to arrest me soon, if I don’t appear.

I again asked, okay tell me the name of the police station, I am coming right now.

To which the guy responded, asking my age. I told them 18 years(actually, it’s 28). He told me that the lady who complained, is standing there itself, and she wants to give me another chance, as I am just a young boy. And told me to settle the matter with her “unofficially”, because (mark his words), I am of his son’s age, and he doesn’t want to see me getting into some trouble. Because if she doesn’t take back the complain, they will have to send a team to arrest me ASAP.

I literally started laughing at this point, and asked them that they are more than welcome to do so, once they manage to find out my address, the same way they have found my number.

Though this time, I felt it’s might be, some friend trying to mess with me. Didn’t get any information from true-caller, suggesting it was a new number.

These cases, I have mentioned above, however, are full fledged scams, and people should really think many times before trusting something “a (wo)man says over a call”.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Two days ago I was traveling to a town In uttar Pradesh where my maternal uncle resides.

I boarded a govt run bus, from Meerut (a district in uttar Pradesh).

We were 4 people and we were traveling to Sardhana. (A small town). Ticket was of 30 rupees, so I asked the conductor for 4 tickets while I was interrogating about the route and bus stand etc. So conductor realized that they are not frequent commuters.

I gave him 120 rupess and he gave me printed tickets. I kept the tickets in my wallet.

After 4–5 kms in journey, the bus stopped and ticket checkers boarded the bus.

The ticker checker came to me and asked for ticket, I searched for the ticket in my wallet and showed it to him confidently. He said these are only two tickets printed on it, where are the other two. I said I bought 4 tickets for 120.

They understood because luckily bus had only 10–15 passengers so conductor could have easily found out if I was doing sth wrong.

They took the conductor and fined him for 900 rupees.

When conductor returned back to the bus he never made eye contact with me.

I went to him and asked to stop doing such petty crimes, he said he forgot and mistakenly gave you two tickets, but we both knew he was lying.

Guys please be aware of such scams and take notice of the tickets while traveling.

Edit 1: Woow more than 500 upvotes, my brain released so many Happy hormones.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Roadside Dhabas on GT Karnal Road

This is a very common scam in North India and I was caught off guard the first time I faced it.

In April, 2015, I, with four friends, was travelling to Mcleodganj from Delhi in a private deluxe bus. Most people prefer travelling at night to Himachal to avoid traffic and save time. The bus started from Delhi at 7 pm and was supposed to reach the destination early morning the next day.

At around 11 pm, the bus stopped for dinner at a roadside Dhaba on the GT Karnal Road. It was surprising to note that a lot of other buses too had stopped at the same Dhaba.

The Dhaba was busy and packed. Only two waiters could be seen running around, serving people. I, being hungry and reckless, hurriedly grabbed a seat with my friends and glanced at the menu. The price of the dishes was unexpectedly higher than usual. We being hungry, did not want to waste time pondering on the same so quickly ordered Shahi Paneer, Dal and Rotis for ourselves.

After about 5 minutes, the waiter kept five compartment plates on our tables. To our surprise, two sections of the plates already had Curd and Salad in them, while the food ordered was separately served to us. Considering those items as complimentary, we quickly had our food and walked to the counter to pay the bill.

To our surprise, we were charged twice as much the expected amount. Seeking clarification, we realised we were charged Rs. 600 extra for the curd and salad. (These items were not listed in the menu either so one could never know if they actually were for Rs. 600.)

Me: “Bhaiya, humne dahi aur salad order nahi kia tha .” (Brother, we did not order for the curd and salad)

Owner: “Toh fir khaya kyu?” (Then why did you eat it)

Me: “Humein laga complimentary hai’ (We thought it’s complimentary)

Owner: “Ab toh paise dene padenge” (You will have to pay for it)

I paid the complete amount because i did not want to have any argument with them. Upon observing for a few minutes, I found that almost all the people at the counter had the same issue with the bill. Whenever someone refused to pay the bill, the owner would call bouncers standing at the back and make people pay.

It was shocking to see such malpractice on a large scale. if he makes 600 Rs extra from each table, imagine the kind of profit he makes in a day.

Bus operators and drivers are paid commission and free food for bringing in customers. They deliberately stop buses at late hours so that people are starving for food by the time they stop, are left with no other option to eat at and thus, dont pay much heed to to this exploitation.

This is common practise across most dhabas in North India and thus one needs to be cautious about this scam. I, for instance, give clear instructions to get only the food that I have ordered and not get anything extra. If they still get you an extra item(which they would), make sure you return it that very moment.

This is one of the scam which happened with me in my recent journey to Delhi from Thrissur, Kerala.

So as usual I ordered a thali (veg) of 80₹ but the irctc employee asked me for ₹180 . Upon asking about the price hike he said, that it was a Special Thali and I gave ₹180 and upon asking about the bill,he gave me this .

I immediately searched for irctc food bill and I came to know that I was scammed because there was no mention of IRCTC bill.

I just tweeted by tagging Indian Railways Indian Railways Catering and Tourism Corporation (IRCTC) and also the photo of the food. They had already added ₹95 for a paneer curry which I even didn't get .

In 20 mins, I was asked for my PNR and my mobile number by the railmadad in my DM. I gave it and in 10 mins , the suprevisor of the pantry came and first tried to justify by saying it was a 'special thali ‘ .

And after around 2 mins of argument he agreed to give me my ₹100 back .

The food items were 4rotis , Rice, dal, paneer and some other sabji and an extra soan pappdi.

So this was one of the scam that I came across recently.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Beware when are doing an Interstate travelling.

When you are travelling from one state to another using National or state highways , there are certain locations which crosses certain cities and has regular traffic , please be aware because there is a gang ready for a well planned accident in order to extract money. The traffic constables are a part of their group as well. They are on lookout for cars from different states .

I have experienced this first hand since I have a car registered with WB number plate and I reside in Hyderabad, we generally plan long weekend trips. I have travelled Karnataka, Maharashtra , Andra Pradesh , Tamil Nadu, Orissa and Pondicherry.

I have travelled twice to Kolkata and back to Hyderabad with my vehicle.

This has happened twice with me now.

First incident took place on my way from Hyderabad to Vizag . We were travelling at night and were about to reach Vizag by 12 am. At around 10 pm we were crossing a town with some mild traffic , pretty exhausted I was driving at around 50 kmph . I did not realise however two bikes with two gentlemen on each bike were blocking the sides and I had no option but to drive straight. There were no dividers but just the lines separating the lanes. One guy on a Luna suddenly made a U-turn in front of me from the opposite lane. Though he was not hit , he purposely fell of his scooter and we had to stop .He did not have a stractch on his body. The people on the two bikes suddenly stopped me. I was surrounded and they started talking in Telugu , I understand Telugu somewhat hence was able to make out this people had started asking for compensation . They asked for 20k right away . The conversation was not going smooth as there was a language barrier. One guy was able to speak broken Hindi though .

With the argument going on , where I was adamant that I was not going to pay a single penny and was ready to take the man for medication and if needed to the police station as well. With no way out , the group which consisted of just 5 people decided to call up the traffic police. They did not dial the number for control room ,instead they dialled a police constable directly who happened to come pretty quick . He started howling without knowing what had happened finally ordered me to pay compensation to the man. I denied straightaway and maintained my stand about taking the injured to the hospital and to the police station as well and will give my explanation there.

With no way out one of the person grabbed my collar. The situation was getting ugly with them making racist comments and me abusing them in return. Finally two CISF personell arrived at the scene. They were able to identify the people and their stupid ways of making money. The constable now understood the racket was being exposed left the scene. The individuals also were cooling down. Though I was pretty nervous up until now finally got some strength now. Now we were the ones pouncing on the indivisuals. They finally left as well and we were ready to go. I was still shaking after the incident. This was the first for me.

Last week I was returning from Hampi back to Hyderabad , the same situation happened. It was just a replica of the previous encounter. I dialled 1033 this time , two individuals in Bolero (the state highway patrol car) came and contacted the police. By the time the police could arrive , the culprits had left the scene.

Always remember when you are the only one driving :

Get proper sleep before you drive.
Do not eat spicy or oily food as it might make you drowsy or even give u the feeling that you are getting Ill.Carry fruits and juices instead.
Make sure you make a pit stop after every 2 or 2:5 hrs depending on your capabilities and roads but do not drive for more than 3 hours at a stretch( no matter what car/truck you are driving).

Driving is fun. Be carefull of people ready to make easy money out of you.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Petrol bunk scam

I was driving back from college and wanted to check the mileage of my bike, so I decided to fill the tank. Went to HP petrol bunk near Ekkattuthangal metro, Chennai).

I asked the attendant to fill the tank. I ensured Zero before he started to fill petrol. While he was filling he asked me to Close the fuel valve. Nobody has ever told me to close the fuel tank since it has no meaning. I felt something fishy and suddenly my friend who was scammed few weeks before came to my mind. He told me that, “Whenever you are alone and an pump attendant tries to distract you, be very careful”.

He was scammed in the exact way I was about to be scammed. (I am glad he shared the story).

The fuel counter was running and stopped at Rs.100. Upon enquiring, he told me that he had set the counter to Rs.100 only as he did not hear me clearly. Since I was wearing an Helmet, I thought my voice was muffled and thus he couldn't hear me properly. I again asked him to fill the tank.

He goes to the fuel dispenser and adjusts the value to Rs.500 . I observed that the counter was not reset to zero but continued from Rs.100. After filling Rs.500 I told him I’ll pay by card.

Him: Should I put both transaction in one bill?

He entered Rs.600 in the swipe machine.

Me: Both transactions? What do you mean by both, I saw the counter run from Rs.0 to Rs.100 and then from Rs. 100 to Rs.500 and thus the bill is only Rs.500.

(Translation to English from Chennai Tamil)

He was numb and didn’t reply anything. He entered Rs.500 in swipe machine without uttering a single word and went to the next customer. I was ready to confront him if he had uttered another word

Location of the Petrol Bunk:

https://www.google.co.in/maps/place/Hindustan+Petroleum+Pump/@13.0155558,80.2039639,19z/data=!4m12!1m6!3m5!1s0x3a52673ed2157191:0x644ae753151a4c12!2sS.I.P.C.O.T+(Olympia+%2F+Tech+Park+)!8m2!3d13.014794!4d80.204495!3m4!1s0x3a52673eb1231e97:0x6628d82ce364898!8m2!3d13.0159611!4d80.2047886

From the reviews in Google maps, It seems that many people have been scammed from this petrol bunk.

Update 1: Thank you puneet mohan for suggesting me to register a compliant in official hp website. A spokesman from hp called me and enquired what has happened and told me that serious steps are being taken and the dealer is also notified of this malicious activity of workers.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Warning: This is my first answer here and it's going to be a lengthy one.

Today I was just cheated of my hard earned money.

Location: Bengaluru, Karnataka, India

As it happened: It was around 4:15pm in the evening when an aged woman approached me, and my friend near the BTM layout park. The woman looked humble and sought our help. She said that she needed some money to return to her native Magadi the same day and had not eaten anything the entire day. Apparently, she was looking for her son, who was a mason, and had brought her here. Somehow she lost her way and she couldn’t reach home without our help.

We were sympathetic and offered help. At first, we offered to take her to a nearby hotel so that we could get her some food. She was reluctant and said that it was getting late and that it would be dark by the time she reached home. We thought that was reasonable and didn't force her into it and decided to help with whatever money we could.

Luckily, I had just ₹10 with me in cash and nothing more. My friend had no wallet with her. We decided to walk to an ATM, withdraw some cash and help the old soul. We withdrew ₹500 and decided to give her ₹100 so that she could reach Magadi (Our calculation: BTM to Majestic - ₹15, Majestic to Magadi - ₹70 approximately). We handed over a crisp ₹100 note and felt good for doing so. To help her out some more, we offered to drop her to the bus station nearby. She reluctantly refused and started briskly walking away, which raised a red flag!

We decided to observe her, and to our surprise, she was joined by another lady, who was in her early 40s, from a crossroad which was hardly 100mts away. We thought, “something is fishy!”. We decided to follow them. They started walking briskly and didn't notice that we were behind. Soon, they found another target - A female standing by the road, maybe a college student. I got nearer to them and heard the same story again from a distance. The girl saw us approaching her. I signaled to her to not to pay them anything as they were scammers. The girl got scared and swiftly moved on.

Now, the duo knew that we were behind them and started to run. The oldie was literally running! Now, it was time for action. I decided to give them a chase. Firstly, though it was a small amount of ₹100, I didn't want to lose it this way. It hurt my ego to know that I was scammed. I wanted to get my money back. Secondly, I wanted to teach them a lesson! I asked my friend to go into a restaurant nearby and wait for me and I would return in a while. I didn't want to put her in trouble (in case anything happened) for my adventure.

By this time, maybe they didn't expect me to give them a chase, they were at their job again. Before I could reach them, a guy wearing a Swiggy uniform was already scammed.Before they could get to their next target, there I was, right in front of them shouting at the top of my lungs. I stand tall at 6′1′’ , with a fairly built physique. Add to this my hard voice. They were scared.

Now, 2 men in their mid 20s came to their rescue and started to yell at me. I didn't budge. I started hurling abuses at those crooks. I was high.. Literally! All this while, I was trying to call 100 but to no luck. The call wasn't getting connected. I showed them my phone screen where it was clearly visible that I had dialed 100 and police were on their way here. The next moment, those men were no where to be seen. I managed to click a few good pictures of the 2 ladies! I looked all around for those 2 men. But they were gone. The old woman at the next moment dropped my ₹100 note on the bike seat that was by the roadside and started to walk away briskly. There I was, back with my money. A sense of satisfaction. :)

My first task of getting my money back was accomplished. Yet, the second task of teaching them a lesson was still incomplete. I Googled for Mico layout police station number and called them and explained them what had just happened. They noted my phone number and a hoysala (Bengaluru City police patrol squad) was at the location in 5minutes and called me. I shared the pictures with them. They assured me of help. I requested them not to hurt them but to warn them so that they don't scam. I didn't file any written complaint. I thought my job was done. Task 2 partially accomplished. This is the best I could do.

I returned to where my friend was, we had a cup of hot coffee and started heading home. I dropped off my friend and boarded a bus to Banashankari.

At Banashankari bus terminal, in my wildest dreams didn't expect to meet them again. There they were waiting to board a bus to Kengeri. How do I know their destination? They asked it to the bus conductor I was sitting in. The bus conductor had a friendly conversation with them. Now I was curious again. I asked the conductor about how he knows them. He knew them since morning when they arrived to seek help in the Bus depot. The morning story was that they had come near the depot to meet a person who had promised them some money. The conductor himself and few of his colleagues had helped them with whatever they could. A scam again! I explained the conductor about what had just happened and he was surprised to know what had just happened!

So friends, taking our sympathy and goodwill for granted is the biggest scam we can ever undergo. This is pure daylight robbery.

Beware of such people.

This is my first answer. Thanks for the patience :)

Edits welcome. Would love to share more.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
One day I ordered dinner on FOODPANDA app. I got a bill of ₹383.60 including GST.
When I got delivery I asked for my bill from the delivery boy and he gave me a KACHCHA bill (hand written on blank paper)

When I saw my Bill on the app there was GST charge included but no GSTIN was mentioned. I inquired and customer care told me that it is not a bill but the invoice and that the bill will be given to you by delivery boy and also the bill is generated by the restaurant and not by their app.

Image source : screenshot

(The total is reduced due to Voucher)

Then I told them that the delivery boy didn't give me a bill written with GST registration number. Then customer care inquired it with the restaurant manager and the manager told them that he has no GSTIN.

So, finally I have got my refund of ₹48.60

This is a common scam. Many restaurants overcharge in the name of GST.

Edit: It happened with me once again and this time also I got my refund.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Arun graduated from engineering college with no job in hand.

Arun’s branch is Mechanical Engineering.

Arun is depressed as he knows his family needs support from him financially.

Arun needs a job so he submitted his resume in various job portal.

After a week, he got a call from a xyz job portal and they told him that his resume has got shortlisted for tata motors, they fixed a telephonic interview.

Arun is happy, finally he has a chance to support his poor family.

He was asked some really easy question in a telephonic interview which he answered correctly and interviewer congratulated him as he was selected for HR round on next day.

Arun prepares for the interview whole night, he mugged up all the possible answers as he did not want to miss this chance.

Arun got a call next day, again some obsolete question was asked which Arun answered perfectly. He was sure that he will get a job but he did not tell anybody as he wanted to surprise everyone.

He got the call next day, a lady congratulated him for the job. Arun was on a cloud nine, he knew the importance of the job, somehow he controlled his emotion and thanked the lady on the phone.

She asked him for all the documents for verification and 5000 rs security money (which is refundable if he join the company).

Arun knew he could not ask for money to his parents so he gave all his savings to that lady.

She called him again and said his documents are fine and he can join his company from xyz date. But he got a job in another state, so he has to give another 10,000 rs for dress, room etc etc.

Now, Arun has already given him his savings and he was left with no money, so he contacted all his placed friends and asked for money, somehow he collected 10000 rs and submitted it to them.

Now, he was waiting for a call.

2 Weeks passed he was still waiting. Now, he called on lady’s no. which is either switched off or not reachable. He tried all the no. from which he got the call, all were switched off.

Arun waited for another 2 week.

No call, no messages, no email.

Arun got scammed.

Edit 1: I am a Mechanical engineer but not Arun.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Food Bill Scam at Movie Threatre

Recently I went to watch Adipurush with my family for a night show at a reputed movie theatre. During the interval, I decided to have some snacks though I completed my dinner at home as it was a night show.

I went to the food counter and waited in the queue for around 5 mins as there was a huge crowd on that day. I ordered 2 chicken sandwiches and 2 medium Pepsi and 1 bucket of caramel popcorn. They told me that it will take 10 mins to make the food so I provided them with my seat number and they would provide me with the food there.

Till now it was all ok, then they gave me the bill which I didn’t check due to hurry, the interval would end within 1-2 minutes. So, I paid them online and went back to my seat. Then after 15 minutes they came to my seat and gave me my food. It was 11 PM and then I found something suspicious, my sandwich was grilled.

I checked my bill and I saw they charged me an extra 100 rupees by adding the grill and extra cheese option in my sandwich which I didn’t order. At first, I thought to let it go because it was night and they might have done some mistake. But then my mom told me that I must report it at least, so I went there immediately leaving the legendary movie-Adipurush.

I went to the person and told him:

Me- Hey! This is Bill and I ordered two normal chicken sandwiches but you gave me grilled sandwiches with extra cheese

The person at Food Counter- Sorry Sir but we don’t have chicken sandwiches so we gave you grilled sandwiches with extra cheese.

Me- So you could have told me, I wouldn't order it.

The person at Food Counter: Sir we serve it like that only, it is our signature item.

Me: You are charging me extra for that without even asking me? How does that work? Did I order your signature item?

The person at Food Counter: No Sir, but we want our customers to try our signature item.

Me: You can charge me extra without taking my permission. Call your manager!

The person at Food Counter: Sir, I am not keeping the money with myself I am giving you the item you have paid for.

Me: I got furious and shouted at him, how can you charge me extra without even asking me and after that, you are arguing with me?

Manager Enters

Manager: What happened, sir?

I explained the full problem

Manager: Sorry sir, we really apologize for the inconvenience and he refunded me the full amount for the sandwich.

Total refund of Rs.400 cash.

The manager didn’t tell anything to the person serving at the counter, maybe they were trained to do that. Most people don’t check their bills in the movie theatre as they rush to watch the movie and also can’t see in the dark hall. So they might take advantage of that. I always recommend everyone to check the bills before paying, else you might end up paying more.

Answers:
Placement service scam!

Yes your heard it right. Now these so called job consultant use clever trick and they know very well that almost engineers are jobless and they are desperate to find a job, they will utilise every possible advertising platform from Facebook, WHATSAPP, gmail, and they ll make even fake website. And finally a desperate person hoping to get a job will approach them, there will a beautiful girl in the front desk asks you to pay Rs-500 registration fees, and it is valid for a year. And then she ll send you inside for further robbing, another girl will ask about you and your profession in a professional manner . then she ll say we do have vacancy and it is a paid job. You need to pay Rs-2000 and after getting job you need to pay half of your salary. That's the trick you will get conned realising that yeah I can pay half of of my salary no worries. And she all take all your documents and ll tell within a week you ll get interview be prepare. Boom. 1 week 2 week….1 month … then again you ll approach them and you ll be angry upset they won't give a shit about that. You ll shout on them and threaten to complain but of no use , we know our police and placement service will have strong network so you won't go further cursing urself. This was you but letme tell you they con atleast 8–10 people on daily basis. Unemployed youth, cheated , conned, frustrated. Those placement servise have turnover in crores. This is for doing job in India scam. And for doing job abroad there's much more worse. I don't know what to tell its getting filthy bussines day by day. I have been cheated by 3–4 times. Its not that I wasn't taken precaution but they convuce you to believe.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
My most recent experience with NISSAN GOA

So it time for a routine service of our car.

There was no problem with the vehicle, it was smooth as butter and didn’t really require servicing but they keep calling you and telling you something might go wrong.

Day 1 - I drop the car at the service station, they told me they’ll service the car and deliver it by the evening.

I get the car back and here’s when the problem starts.

The engine malfunction light kept popping up if I went above 60 km/hr or accelerated a little hard.

So I call the service centre back and tell them the problem.

They ask me to drop the car back immediately and not to push the car to hard.

Next day, evening I get a call and the technician on the other side tells me that a fuel injector has broken down and it needs to be replaced and it will cost around 1.2Lac. I was like wtf…I knew something was not right..I took the car back and showed it to the nearby garage.. note: when I took the car back from them I could hardly drive the car, it couldn’t pick up speed after 2nd gear and the vibrations were equivalent of those in tata busses. The engine sounded entirely different as if there was no silencer.

Anyway, after I showed it in the garage the guy tells me the same thing, the injector has broken off and he could fix it up but it would cost around 40k. Again I felt something is fishy and brought the car home. If The injectors would have broken off then there would have been no chance that the engine would even start up.

So, I tell my dad all this and he tells me to give it back to the nissan dealer next day and let them fix it up.

Next morning, I was about to give the car back but thought of just having a glance of the engine myself. I removed the upper engine cowling and started inspecting the cylinder and found one connection was amiss.

I randomly connected it and started the engine.

Viola

All problems gone. I car was back to normal.

No warning light, smooth as hell.

Later I did a bit of a research and found that they had disconnected the intake pipe. The car was running on 3 pistons instead of 4 and the mismatch of the cam shaft timings caused the intense vibrations.

I would say I got lucky,

but people beware..

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
It's the Power Bank scam.

Nowadays you travel in train or shop roadside, you are sure to see hawkers selling Power Banks for a much less rate say ₹150-₹200

So these are really cheap compared to those online and with all those Brand tags, you may feel it's a great offer!

But,

Take a look inside the device

One battery with a LED strip and pouches filled with sand to fake the weight

And believe me that battery lasts just for the time being to let the hawker gets away from your sight.

Your phone would probably charge your power bank!

Beware friends,

Not everything cheap is genuine!

Note: This has happened with my cousin and my friends initially and not with me so ain't got a live picture of the Power bank.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Cafe Coffee Day, Alwarpet, Chennai.

Yesterday, I ordered a Classic Cappuccino Regular at a CCD outlet. The price on the menu was Rs. 110 so I was expecting to pay around 120/- including GST. To my surprise, the final amount was Rs. 140/-. At this point, the person at the counter hadn't given me the copy of the bill yet. I repeatedly asked her for it so as to confirm the price (in case the menu was an older version and they had revised their rates). She said she'd give me the copy along with my order.

10 minutes later, she brought me the coffee but not the bill. On reminding her a couple more times, she finally hands it over to me wherein I noticed that I had been billed for a Toffee Cappuccino with a base price of Rs. 133/- plus 5% GST so Rs. 140/- in all.

On confronting her, she said that their billing machine didn't show the Classic Cappuccino option in the drop down menu so she had to select the Toffee option. After arguing with her saying that in such a situation she should've chosen another similarly priced item to bill and that I wanted a refund of the excess amount paid, she casually said that they couldn't do anything about it now. I asked to speak to the manager to which she replied that he wasn't available. I asked her to call him over the phone in front of me. She went to the billing counter and pretended to speak to someone (I know that she was pretending because I was staring daggers at her by this time and how many times have we employed the same trick?). Finally, she came over and handed me Rs. 24.

That particular outlet is a popular spot for meetings and such and if this has been going on for ages, just imagine the extent of the scam.

Edit: Since a lot of people have insisted that I share the name of the CCD outlet, I've updated the answer. But this is not the only CCD outlet where I have faced this particular issue of overbilling and going by the responses in the comments, it seems to be a common occurrence. I request all of you to take the time (a couple of minutes at the most) to cross check the bill.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This is what happened to me Yesterday.

After a long day in office, I decided to go to Burger King with my friend. The person taking the orders asked me for my order.

I told him that I want 2 medium veg supreme meals. To which he straight away, without entering any information in his computer, said that the total was Rs. 271/-. Since I am a frequent customer at Burger King, I knew that the amount would be this only, but since he didn’t enter any information in his computer, I asked him to enter my order in the system. (Remember that no customer need not to inform the counter guy to do this, as it is his/her duty to feed the information on the computer)

Then after entering, he showed me the screen of his computer. The order bill was Rs. 271/-. He reacted in such a way that it was my fault that I asked him to put the order details in the system.

I made the payment with my card and got the payment receipt immediately. But then I noticed that he had deleted the order details and therefore neither the bill got printed nor my order went to the display in the kitchen (I knew this because I was observing everything after he showed me, in disgust, that my order amount was Rs. 271/-).

Then I asked him to give me my bill. He said that the bill was supposed to be kept by them only and need not be given to customers (My order still didn’t go through). I told him that I was not born yesterday and I wanted my copy of the bill. After this he told me that the bill printing machine was not working and the bill got stuck in the machine. I still demanded my copy of bill. He then entered the details again in his computer, and gave the order. Then what I noticed was that the bill printing machine was working just fine and that there was no bill stuck in that machine.

And even after that the person gave me a look as if I had done something wrong.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
This happened to me a few days ago at KFC.

I was returning home after attempting an exam from my test center which was 70kms away. I was exhausted and starving, so I decided to stop at the first restaurant I see and grab something to eat. I came across a KFC and ordered a Veg. Potato Krisper. As expected, I was given the extra cheese and combo offer which I cleverly declined.

I was asked to pay ₹45 and I did. I was exhausted but while the burger was being prepared I glanced at the bill as I wanted to see the implementation of recent 5% GST law on food items.

I noticed that the burger was for ₹38.33 before tax, and should be charged ₹40.25 after taxes, but was billed ₹45.

Even though ₹5 is nothing, I was curious about it and asked the server why was I charged ₹5 extra in name of HOPE. He got a little nervous, stared at the bill for 10 seconds and then passed the bill to his colleague and asked me to talk to him. This person also got nervous and offered me to refund the ₹5. I told him that I wanted to know the reason for this charge. He then called his manager and showed him the bill. The manager saw it and then, facing his left, shouted in thin air “Tum logo ne abhi tak theek nahi kara isse?” (You guys haven’t repaired it yet). I now thought that it was an honest mistake and will be rectified, and so went home satisfied.

A few days later I was telling this to a friend who lives nearby that outlet, and he told me that he’d visited KFC just the day before and started searching for the bill to check the amount. Alas, I find that he was also charged extra.

The scam here is that they deliberately charge this extra amount. Since it’s a small amount, no one seems to notice especially after reduction in GST. This amount goes directly into their pockets, which is highly unethical.

Edit 1:

I have received a lot of comments suggesting me that HOPE is an NGO or that this may be a mistake.

I know what it is, the name gives you a clear indication and I searched about it as soon as I left the outlet. The issue was they added it without asking or notifying, I’ll be happy to donate if it’s genuine and for a good cause.
I also thought it’s an honest mistake and went home, it was only when they also charged my friend that I got suspicious.
What was even more surprising was that none of the staff was aware of what it is.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
There are 100+ answers for this question. Pardon me if this is redundant.

I’m describing my experience in Amazon (not stereotyping, might happen in any online shopping website) which everyone needs to be aware of!

We recently moved to a new house at Urapakkam, outer suburb of Chennai. We wanted to buy some new things like cot with mattress, sofa set, chairs etc. We decided to go with Amazon as it is one of the most trusted shopping website. So while surfing sofa sets, we came through a beautiful five seater sofa. We checked its price and it was lot less than we thought! Rs. 20000! Check it for yourself.

Then we ordered it and paid using debit card. After 2 - 3 days, I got a call from the seller itself. I received the call and the conversation went like this.

He : Hello, am I speaking to Mr. Prasanth Raj? This is regarding your enquiry about the five seater sofa set at Amazon.

Me : Yeah, tell me.

He : Sir, have you paid for the product or it is a cash on delivery?

Me : I paid for the product and it is supposed to be delivered by tomorrow, right?

He : Sir I have a concern, actually, Amazon will take 14 days to credit us your money, could you please cancel the product and order it again with COD as payment option?

Me : Nope. I won't cancel it. If that’s the case, you should have mentioned in the product description that Cash on Delivery option is preferable.

He : Sir, if you need the order right away, I’m located in Vanagaram, Chennai only. I can ship it personally to you. Could you please cancel your order?

Me : I’ll call you back in an hour.

(Hung up the Phone.)

I was pretty doubtful at this moment as he was insisting me to cancel the order. So I went to Amazon website to check the product again. That is the point where I realized he was trying to scam me. The Price of the product shot up to Rs. 32000!

That was the reason why he wanted me to cancel the order and order it once again, by putting a lame reason (Cash on delivery) for it .

I called him right away and the conversation went like this.

Me : Hi, I’m Prasanth again. (In a stern voice) It won't matter if it is late, you can ship the product after 14 days once you receive the payment.

He : In 14 Days? But..but..

It is a highly delicate one. It has cushion in it. It has to be handled safely. I don’t trust Amazon delivery as they might mishandle it and at last you’ll return the product. We had experiences like that.

Me : (Chuckled) Then Label the product “Handle with care” and Amazon will handle it safely during the delivery. I’ll also intimate Amazon regarding this.

He : Amazon won't respond properly to these. They will liberally fail on their delivery.

Me : You are talking trash about an organization which has one of the best customer service experience in the world? Uh? I won't cancel the order and that is final and you need to ship it.

He : Ok.. (Hangs up as soon as I told him that.)

I reported this incident to amazon and they thanked me for reporting the incident and assured that I’ll get the product in perfect condition. They also told me that, never have any personal assurances with the seller on online shopping portals. (They could have simply mentioned “on amazon”. Instead they wanted to teach the ethics of Online shopping to their customers. Wow!)

Moral : Never ever have personal assurances with seller. Mostly, it will be a scam. Your communication should be with your online shopping portal and not with the seller. It is really unprofessional that a seller calls you and talks to you convincingly. Please turn those things down!

I request everyone to be aware of this.

Edit :

The seller might also try other stuffs like these to make you cancel the order :

Telling you that the product is out of stock.
If the payment is Cash on delivery, He might ask you to cancel it and order it via Online Payment. (Other way around of what I experienced.)
He has shipped to the wrong address.

In all these cases, seller wants you to cancel the order. So please decline it and ask him to contact amazon (or the particular shopping portal) instead of contacting you. Tell him firmly that you need the product anyways.

Edit 2 :

Some of the Questions by the fellow Quorans.

Q : How did Amazon gave my contact info to the seller?

A : Seriously, I don’t know, how he got. But Anneerrudh Mmahepate in the comment section pointed out that, the maximum dimension of product that Amazon delivers is 70 cm x 70 cm and 45 cm, max weight 18 kgs. So Amazon would have directly asked the seller to ship it to me and thereby passing my contact info.

Q : How was the Product’s condition when it got delivered?

A : This incident happened just yesterday (5/12/17) and I’m also eagerly waiting for the product to be delivered to me. Will update you on the condition on the sofa set.

Final Edit :

The seller cancelled the order by himself. Amazon sent me a mail like “Sorry for the order cancellation, the seller didn't ship the product within the speculated time.” :(

My Aqua-guard stopped working. Called customer care and asked to send representative. Customer care told me that as my machine is out of warranty it would be paid visit (Rs 425) + cost of spare parts, to which I said okay.

On the same day technician from Aquaguard arrived. He asked me the problem.

Me - I’ve been told that there was a spark sound from inside and it stopped working afterwards.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Would like to share 2 such instances which I faced in last few months…

Went to a local fruit seller to get some Apples chose the ones which looked fairly red in color and of medium size even bargained the price down, paid the seller and came back to my room just to find out that the Apples which I thought I had paid for were not the ones in the plastic bag handed over to me instead these were raw and smaller in size. I later shared this incident with my flatmates and was shocked to hear same type of incidents occured to them as well…
Early morning incident was getting late for my class so was in hurry and went to the nearest petrol pump, asked the guy to put ₹500 worth of petrol (never refill with round figure amount which I later got to know from many Youtube posts and of course Quora) . Although I was watching the zero and had a rough idea as to how much petrol in liters will be filled in bike’s tank I was watching the numbers spin on that meter, the attendant then moved an arm strangely towards machine and the whole machine stopped and went blank, I enquired what happened he said some problem might have occurred when machine restarted it reset to zero and he said that he filled ₹500 petrol, I sensed something wrong and raised my voice and questioned him how he would fill ₹500 petrol when the meter said some 4 lr just before shutting down but he was adamant then I got even more louder and asked him to call his supervisor and explained to him the situation he too was adamant that proper fuel was given to me, then I questioned him to give me proof via the billing machine which is installed on petrol pumps and voila it showed that although the amount of ₹500 was punched in the fuel, refill was of ₹430 only he apologized immediately and asked other guy to fill the remaing amount of petrol.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Scam by Taxi drivers at Mumbai railway station

This happened to me a few days back. As semester holidays are over by the end of July, I traveled on the train to Mumbai LTT railway station and to get to my hostel, I decided to take a cab from LTT railway station to IIT Bombay.

So, while the train is about to reach the station, it’s early morning and at 5:00 AM, I booked a cab in the Uber. The app showed the estimated cost to be about ₹180.

It might be even less as there would be no traffic early in the morning.

When the train reached the station, I got off. Immediately, a taxi driver came to me and asked me if I need a taxi to which I denied and started moving. But he kept following me insisting, asking me where should I go. I told him that I booked a cab in Uber. Then, he said that Uber and Ola were not allowed near the railway station saying their fair was not constant and some other reasons.
He even told me, he won’t charge any extra and he’ll just go by meter.
(I’m from Andhra Pradesh, so I can’t speak Hindi very fluently. So, I have issues in communicating with him)
So, I agreed to him and followed him to his taxi.

Then I asked him to turn off night meter(something that calculates extra fare when you take a taxi at night) to which he agreed.
Then, in about 20 min, he dropped me in front of the IIT main gate. It’s still dark outside.
Then he showed me the amount on the meter. It’s ₹402 and it’s a shock for me. (I understood that he turned on night meter)
I tried to argue with him saying it’s too high but he had some explanation for every argument. I felt it’s useless to argue, got off the cab, took ₹100 from him, gave him a 500 rupee note and took my bag to move.
Then he called me back.
Showing a 200 rupee note in his hand, he said that I forgot and gave him a 200 rupee note instead of 500 rupee note in the dark. So, I checked my purse back.
(Just before getting on the train, I withdrew two 500 rupee notes from ATM. Then, I had only one 500 rupee note. So, I must have given him one).

So, I started arguing in a little bit loud voice saying he was trying to cheat and I actually gave him a 500 rupee note. (Just to remind, I can't speak Hindi fluently and it’s difficult for me to even argue).
After exchange of some words, he acted like he was frustrated and decided to let it go.
Then when I’m about to leave, he again asked me extra ₹100 as parking fee for parking his cab near the railway station.

I replied to him saying that that’s not an airport, there will be no parking fee at the railway station and left that place without looking back.

So, guys, always opt to Uber or Ola, especially at railway stations. The taxi drivers have a hell lot of ways to cheat you and be careful.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
When you travel from Bengaluru airport by any taxi service, you are bound to pay ₹125 toll charge. There are 2 scams here:

There is no single route toll charge. So you need to pay the return route charges though you don't come back to airport.
The fare in Uber/Ola do include toll charges but still the driver asks you to pay them.

This happened with me recently and accidentally I went through the fare breakup of Uber receipt where I found the charges for toll are already included. Luckily I raised a complaint and got refund! Thanks to Uber! But many people won't bother to read the receipt. Next time when you take a ride from Bangalore airport, do take a note of this!

Thanks,

Archana

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
Incident 1:

My phone rings, and thanks to TrueCaller app, the caller is identified as ATM Fraud.

Still to play along I decided to pick it up.

The person on other side was speaking in typical Bihari Hindi accent.

Scammer: Sir mai ATM head department se baat kar raha hu (I am talking from head office of ATM)

Aap jo ATM card use kar rahe hai, wo expire ho gaya hai (The ATM card you are using is expired now)

Kya app extend karwana chahte hai? (do you want me to extend it?)

Since I already knew who he was, I responded cautiously

Me: Uske liye kya karna hoga? (What do I have to do for it?)

Scammer: Aap Debit card ka number, CVV aur pin share kijiye, mai yaha se aapko authenticate karke card ko extend karwa deta hu (Share your ATM card number, CVV and pin so that I can authenticate you and extend the validity)

Me: (after a little pause) kyu karte ho ye sab? accha kuch kaam karo (Why do you do all these scams? Do something good)

After this he started abusing me and disconnected the call

Incident 2:

I was roaming on the streets near Calangute beach, all of a sudden a person appeared in front of me. He had bunch of tickets in his hands. He asked me to pull a random ticket saying it is a lucky draw .

When I picked a card and checked, it said “Better luck next time”

Then he handed over another ticket to my wife and asked her to check.

To our surprise this time we had won a laptop in our lucky draw.

As always, I suspected that there is something fishy about it. Because no one gives free laptops on the street just like that.

But when he explained us how to “claim” this prize, we were certain that this is a scam.

Basically the clause was to visit their office somewhere in Goa, look at their products. Buy them and then collect my “lucky prize” laptop somewhere in Mumbai.

We immediately shun him.

Bottom line: Nothing is free here. Behind every free offer, there is always a jobless scammer brain trying to loot your money

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
No, Ola and Uber are not scams but few people are using these services to scam other people.

The following incident happened with a colleague of mine -

One day my colleague (Let's call him X) was returning to his room after the work (around 10 PM). He was waiting at road for a shared auto and then 3 young guys came near to him. One of the guy said that their friend is really sick and due to some network issues they are not able to book a cab. Mr. X is a very innocent person and he is always ready to help anyone and without giving any second thoughts he booked a cab from his account.

Next day, he was busy working at his desk and someone called him. He picked up the call and it was a call from police station and they asked him to reach police station. The guys for whom he booked a cab had beaten the cab driver and took away all of driver's money, his mobile and other accessories like watch etc. The police men grabbed his collar, started abusing him and also threatened to file a criminal case against him. He explained his side and said he got nothing to do with those guys but all in vain.

Now the police men saw this as an opportunity to squeeze money from him. Police said give us 1 Lakh Rupees and we will set you free from this case. 1 Lakh is a very big amount, especially for a young guy working in BPO. Police men gave him time period of 2 days to arrange money. Mr. X somehow arranged 30 thousand rupees which he saved from his salary but soon he realized he can't arrange 1 Lakh Rupees in 2 days. So, he decided to leave the city and he packed all of his things and left for his hometown in Jharkhand in midnight. Police came to our office to inquire about him and also filed a case against him.

Due to criminal case no one from our office is in contact with Mr. X and we still don't know how he is doing.

Mr. X belongs from a lower middle class family and he arrived Delhi with high hopes but due to a small mistake of booking a cab his dreams got shattered and now he is living in his home town which a very small city in Jharkhand with no opportunities.

I request all of people to never book a cab for a stranger. Your one act of kindness can turn out to be your biggest mistake.

Questions: What are common scams in India?
Answers:
AIRTEL POSTPAID ( Please read this )

** charged extra for using previous unused data.

“Your unused data at the end of the month, will be always added back to your data allowance for the next month” - This is what Airtel promised recently.

This whole 'promise' thing was implemented from the month of September 2017.

I have Rs. 199 postpaid plan ( 100 local mins and 675mb data/month).

From September my unsused data was being added to current month data (September-> October-> November)

As you can see above around 1.81 Gb unused data was added to my current ( November) monthly plan + 675 mb.

Scam starts here :

Today, I received my November month bill which was Rs. 556. I was in shock since I never have paid or received a bill more than 300 rs.

I requested bill details. And you can cleary see from my bill details that they charged me for using previous months unused data.

My allocated qouta - 675mb (converted using formula they provide)

Total usage - 1690mb

Chargeable usage - 1015 mb (WHY??)

There is no mention of my previous unused data ( 1.8gb )in the bill. They should clearly mention the total unused data from previous months in the current month bill.

Edit: Airtel just called me and agreed to waive off extra charges.

I don't know if it was intentional or due to technical error. But guys, ALWAYS CHECK YOUR BILL PROPERLY. DON'T BE IGNORANT.

Just think if same error happens to 10 people and 6 out of 10 ignores and pays the bill with extra charge. Now, you can calculate how much profit such company will earn.

Here, I am not trying to defame Airtel. But the thing is most people don't check their Bill properly and pay extra amount. I think I should keep this anwer just to make people aware about such incident/error.
